<user_id>108012598562686071767< /user_id><user_name>Eric Gray (UrsusArctosMajor)</user_name><Date>1489951935638< /Date><rate>4< /rate>< text>
I'm reserving a star for consistency: we'll be back.  We had 2 orders of the crunchy, hot & perfectly cooked fish and chips and then an order of chili cheese fries.  We were hungry.  Everything came quickly and was very tasty.  Perfect for pre-dusk outdoor cheap eats at the beach.  The tiny table near the shack was clean and well situated near a propane space heater.

I would have left the fries in the boiling oil for maybe 45-60 seconds longer, but then I like them crunchy.  So that's just me.  I'm sure that the friendly staff would have obliged.

I feel a warning is due however, though it has nothing to do with the quality of the food or service: this place closes promptly at 7.  As we were digging the last delicious chili nuggets out of the bottom of the paper dish around 7:20pm, various people approached the snack bar and were disappointed that it had closed.

Don't be those people.

The cafe that shares the building with the snack bar is considerably more sophisticated and the prices reflect this.  So make a point to drop by the snack bar earlier and take advantage of the warming tower things.

We'll be back.<//text>

<text>Only had the ice cream and baked goods, but they were delicious. The ice creams are rich and flavorful, the pastries are sweet moist moist and the pizza is delightful if you're into sourdough (which I am not). The only problem is the layout. It is a busy spot and the lines tend to extend in front of the building, but there's no real space between the parking for the cars and the spot for the lines. Also, make sure you know if you're in line for the coffee bar or the main take out window. They tend to merge and make it seem longer than it may be.<//text>< Pictures>

<Resp>None</Resp>< review>
This is about the bakery at Parkside -
This might be one of the best bakeries in Marin. One would not think there would be an excellent French bakery in the little town of Stinson Beach, but there is. Perfectly flakey and buttery croissants. Other delicious morning pastries. And thankfully a bunch of savory vegetarian pastries. Reasonably priced, delicious coffee. The cheese bread loaf is a thing of dreams. This little spot is worth a visit when in Stinson.< /review>

1570683465843<//Time>
<rate>4<//rate><Review>Some of the web info is out of date. We went to a proper restaurant in the evening. The evening meal features serious haute cuisine, some excellent dishes displaying real skill by what must be a talented chef, including a crab risotto of exceptional quality, a delicious clam chowder, and some superbly cooked tuna, and a very good avocado pasta. The green salad was very fine. We (British tourists) ate there two nights running and had the two best meals in three weeks in the USA. A special eatery in a very special place. Why no fifth star? Nobody is perfect!</Review>< Pictures>

< user_id>
111195644025352415678< /user_id>
<Name>Aaron Grogan-Jackson<//Name>< time>
1542056875696</time>
<Rating>4< /Rating>< review>
Parkside has a snack bar, café, a market, and restaurant. The restaurant has indoor and outdoor dining. Some of the items the snack bar offers is hamburgers, chicken nuggets, fries, milkshakes, and soft serve ice cream. If you are in Stinson Beach, it's a great place to grab a meal to go. Beware, the snack bar does not have a bathroom. If you want to eat higher end food, you can use the bathroom in the restaurant. Parkside has the best selection of food options in Stinson Beach.< /review>

<userid>114265795386171720578<//userid><user_name>Ben Rousseau< /user_name><Date>1533874357143< /Date><Rate>1</Rate>< Review>
Parkside Snack Bar:
This Place used to be really great. However, more recently the prices of ice cream (which used to be really cheap for a large serving) have gone up over a dollar and the portion has gone way down. You basically pay $2.50 for less than a mouthful of ice cream. You be the judge, but to me, that is a complete rip off. I would not recommend this place for ice cream.<//Review>

<user>113664862339730829320<//user>< name>
John Schafer< /name>
< date>
1448910927066<//date>
< rate>
4< /rate>
<text>We had been told about Stinson Beach, so we took the drive there and enjoyed some time on the sand.  It was November, so we were not swimming, but there were some surfers out in the water.  We still enjoyed walking the beach, and grabbing lunch at the Parkside.  In our group, we had their veggie burger (looked home-made, not store bought processed one), along with a cheeseburger, grilled tuna sandwich, and an order of their fish & chips.  Everything was very good.  Only downside is that they do not have any seating protected from the winds, nor any heaters, which would have been nice on the cool, windy day when we were there.  I'd go back here again next time we are in the area, so long as it's a decent day outside.  If it's windy & cool, next time we'll look for other options.< /text>< Pics>
None< /Pics>

< review>
This is for the outside walk up service..
The menu is great. The bacon burger is awesome. Its a throw back so if your looking for a monster burger this is not it. It's less than a 1/4 lb but served with thick bacon and relish. Very similar to Tic Tocs in San Francisco back in the day. In other words, its a classic beach burger. The fries were topped off with salt and pepper and the smoothie was great with no yogurt so its a beverage not a meal.
Also, the twist cone was really good. Kid friendly spot with a play structure across the street.<//review>

<Text>Stumbled across this place while on an impromptu drive through Stinson Beach. Very friendly service and good food. The burger was made from Niman Ranch beef! You wouldn't believe how hard it is to find good quality meat at restaurants in NYC and Jersey City, so I really appreciate that this place takes care in their sourcing. Also, the bread and pastries are all made in house. Along with beer from a local brewery in Fairfax, I was impressed with this quaint spot on the beach. You don't get that kind of quality in most touristy locations. They also have a patio outside, and all heaters looked functional to me. Try it out next time you're in the area.</Text><rating>5<//rating>< Pictures>

Ok the bread is now baked fresh and sold at the restaurant.  That's fine.  It's great bread, I really like it BUT they are now offering it to you by your wait person as " Can I get you started with some bread?"   Sure I said assuming we were going to get bread put on the table like all restaurants do.   Well it turns out it costs 3:00 !!!    They didn't mention that! <UserId.>104981312154361356048< /UserId.><review>The food here was fine, but not spectacular, especially for how much it cost. The fresh bread was good, but the french fries were mediocre and not helped by the fact that they were room temperature. At dinner we had the club sandwiches with ahi tuna and crab cake, and they were just okay. The brioche buns were tasty, but not really sturdy enough for the sandwiches. We also had breakfast here and the scrambled eggs and bacon were good, but both the French toast and the buttermilk pancake were kind of meh. If we'd gotten out of there for $20 it would have been fine, but it was closer to twice that. Service at breakfast on Sunday morning at 7:30 was speedy, but service at dinner on Saturday night was way too slow. We waited a long time for our bread appetizer to be delivered and then even longer for a cup of soup to arrive before our entrees. And it was really loud inside at dinner when it was busy. Hard to have a conversation in here without shouting over everyone else.</review>< date>

One positive note, though. their bread and pastries are great! Croissants and baguette are really good.< /Text><Pics>None< /Pics>< response>

<Review>I gave this restaurant two stars, mainly because it was below average for the price, which was moderately expensive, and the wait staff wasn't that friendly.  However, from driving around stinson and reading reviews of other restaurants, this place is probably one of the best restaurants in town.  The food was good, and they had good beer.  The view out the window is of a park, although I thought the park looked kinda ratty.  (At the time, there was a couple inch puddle of water across most of it.)  On the other side of the park are the sanddunes, on the other side of which is the beach.  You can't see the beach from the restaurant.

I got the white wine seafood pasta, which was good, although I prefer it a little more creamy.</Review><name>Steven Baker</name><Gmap_id>0x808593cf2dc72573:0x7982a736ed5a943e</Gmap_id>< resp>

< user_id>
100317833931102218342</user_id>
<name>Daivat Dholakia< /name><Date>1412954489719</Date>< rate>
3< /rate>
< Text>
We were at Stinson beach last Sunday and we wanted to grab lunch so we headed down to Parkside Cafe around 2 PM since it is the closest to the beach. Outdoor seating had a 30 minute wait so we just headed in the restaurant where seating was easily available. We ordered garlic cheesy bread which was served hot and garlicky within 15 minutes. We also got the polenta burger and onion rings which to our surprise took 30-40 minutes to be served after the order. The burger was nice, it had a good taste/texture and wasnt too heavy. Burger came with fries which were crisp and fresh. On the contrary, the onion rings took even longer to be served and were drenched in oil. They were so oily that we couldnt finish the 4 huge onion rings that were served. After having the first one we saw the oil on the plate of onion rings and that was it. We decided to not go to this place again.< /Text>

<rating>1<//rating><text>Hmmm...where to start?  Ambiance was about the only redeeming quality, and maybe the vintage white bar stools in the waiting area..those were kind of cool too.  My girlfriend and I dared to try it out despite all of the negative reviews and we crapped out across the board.  This is what we got for 54 dollars (tip included):  2 crab cakes that looked suspiciously of the frozen variety, a decent burger and a mountain of standard variety french fries.  In retrospect, I think the bread out of the oven may have been the best part of the meal.  It's now 5 hours later and my girlfriend has an upset stomach and is releasing farts strong enough to kill a donkey or send poltergeist ghosts on to the next house.  This is not the way I envisioned our last night in Stinson at our romantic beach house getaway.  Given the gross overpricing alone, I would strongly urge anybody visiting Stinson to give this place a pass.  A wiser move would be hitting up the Whole Foods in Mill Valley and stocking up before coming down if your accommodation has a fridge and kitchen unit.</text><Date>1319962240742< /Date>< name>
algin amores</name>

<user_id>103051424771774427960</user_id><user_name>Spooky Emer</user_name><Time>1411581939715</Time><rating>1< /rating><Text>My 1st time visiting Stinson Beach was tainted by the unpleasant and unnecessary experience in Parkside Cafe.

If you're dark brown, this place will make you feel unwelcome.

From the front door to our table, I got stopped 3 times. Once to be questioned why I'm just walking straight in. Next was that I shouldn't skip the toilet queue so I had to tell them, that's not what I'm here for. Why people assume without asking pisses me off. Lastly, I was questioned where I was going so I pointed to the table where all my friends were sitting at already. By the time I sat down, I was so annoyed and had wished I had walked in with all my WHITE friends.

Whatever happened to, 'Welcome to Parkside' can I help you?' Instead of accusing and assuming. Why are staff so quick to judge negatively? I was not dressed like a bum or anything.

One apologized but I had already lost my appetite and felt so uncomfortable.

The table I sat at had prime view of the front door  so I can see who goes in and out. In the hour I was there, people would walk in all the time, just like I did. NOONE ELSE WAS STOPPED LIKE I WAS. Even the ones that would just stroll straight to the toilet. Then again, I didnt see anyone dark skinned.

To add to the insult, I had ordered onion rings. Everyone's food arrived and even though the server (blonde blue eyed) saw I had nothing in front of me, she said nothing.
Nothing like, 'Did you order?' or 'have u ordered' Though she had taken all our orders and I was not last to order either. Finally after 5 mins, thank goodness I asked. Server told me that someone else took my order and that a fresh batch is getting made. Needless to say, friends waited for me to be done since it was too hot to eat when it finally arrived.

My hubby who is a fan of clam chowder didn't even want to tolerate the small cup. It was so thick. You could pick up the soup with your fork. Just like the white paste you use it school.

I had been at the cafe earlier to get food to go and the folks there were no better. I had mentioned that the mayo had run out and would there be more. The only response from this guy was, 'no more mayo!' then walked away. If you hate your job, don't take it out on the customer!

This place is very popular and right by the entrance to the beach so perhaps they do not see a need to have repeat business in mind. I do not need to ever step foot here. Food is not that unique or to die for.

There are a ton more awesome cafes here to try. I will be avoiding Parkside like a plague.

What is the world coming to when we cannot even just be kind to a fellow human being?</Text>< pictures>
None</pictures>

< text>
This place is the best! Receptionist is very polite.  They give you a tour when you first come in. The inside of the place looks brand new, hip, and is clean. I went in to see Dr. Casey to remedy constant sciatic pain I was having after going to a physical therapist that was no help. Dr. Casey and the rest of the staff were very friendly. Dr. Casey took the time to answer every questions I had very thoroughly. After the first visit, I immediately felt better (This was just my experience. Obviously everyone’s is going to be different based on your circumstances). The next day my pain was nearly gone and I no longer had problems and severe pain when standing up and walking. I am continuing to see Dr. Casey even after he thoughtfully recommended a colleague of his that was more local to my home. I turned it down after being so happy with my experience at Life Source  chiropractic. I feel the drive is worth it. Definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for a good chiropractor.< /text>

<userid>101426734925311614774< /userid><Name>Becca<//Name><time>1582238790135</time><Rate>5< /Rate>< Review>
I brought my son to Life Source Chiropractic when he was only three months old after a PT noticed he had torticollis. Dr. Kasey was absolutely wonderful! He answered several questions on the phone and in person. I was so nervous to have adjustments done on such a young child, but Dr. Kasey explained that the pressure they use is the amount of pressure you would feel comfortable placing on your eyelid. He was so gentle with my son and corrected the issue in only two visits. Everyone at this practice is kind and helpful. It is obvious how much they care about their work and their patients. I highly recommend their pediatric services.< /Review>

<Rating>5< /Rating><review>Three years ago, I injured my back & haven't felt right since. During that time, I worked with 5 different chiropractic offices that each told me that they understood why I was in pain & that they were capable of helping me heal. With each chiropractor I worked with, I felt so excited to hear that addressing my pain was a reality, & that they could help me get back to feeling normal. Unfortunately, each time I was told that, I continued to feel pain & discomfort. I was at the end of my rope, didn't even believe chiropractors could help me any longer, & was emotionally in the dumps due to my constant discomfort.

Then, about 4 months ago, I met Dr. Chase. After discussing my situation with him, he convinced me to give chiropractic care one more chance - I was apprehensive at first but figured, what the heck - let's give it one more try.

After 4 months of treatments, this week was the first full week in 3 years that my discomfort hasn't kept me up at night or affected me throughout my entire day & I believe it's due to the quality care I received at Life Source Chiropractic. Beyond their high level of care, their support staff has been impeccably professional, positive, & helpful. Take it from someone that knows local chiropractors - don't waste your time & energy going elsewhere. Stop reading reviews now & just go ahead & schedule your appointment. It'll be the best decision you make for your health this year.< /review>< Pictures>

The doctors are amazing as well, people who genuinely love their career and want to help people with their body issues. <Rating>5<//Rating>< Review>
Been in treatment since September 2018 with Life Source Chiropractic. I have another 2 weeks to go and I been treated here for half year now. Today March 25th 2019 got out with no pain on my neck and feeling in alignment like never before in my life.
I have only good, very good and excellent things to say about this office.
From day one they all been very professional, courteous and with a bright smile on. I feel like home when come in here.
Thank you Dr. Chase Parlett, Dr. Kasey Pierce and Carla (as well Brittany in the past) the 2 sweet ladies at the reception area.
All of them been so amazing with me all these 6 months of treatment.
I referred you and I will continue to do so because I know your level of care for people, clients, and patients.
I also been treated as a member of a bigger family here, being invited to their few promotional parties and feeling so good to be around all of you.
This is the only place where they actually do an Rx before they start the treatment and have a computerized system in the room where you can see your spine Rx and been adjusted where is needed.
Because of their attention to detail I found out after 10 years from a car accident in the past that one of my cervical spinal process was  broken.
Been to another office before coming here, had an Rx done there and that dr. never saw or made me aware I have an old fracture on my cervical spine putting me to do tractions on that lower part of my cervical spine creating more damage to my neck.
As a CMT I need to function at full capacity and any disalighment can create more stress on my body.
Well here at this office I got realigned to the point of almost no pain.
Thank you Dr. Chase Parlett for your contribution to my wellbeing and recovery.
My gratitude to you.

Brindusa Ses
CMT</Review>

< resp>
{'time': 1488998664100, 'text': 'Thanks Jeff for the beautiful lengthy review!  We really appreciate our customers who make it possible for us to live in this beautiful area we call home.  Over the years we have watched many youngsters grow up!  It is so fun to watch the progression from little tiny people, to gangly teenagers, and in some cases to young adults! < gmapID>
0x8082deb4b6a54e05:0xc96fe1eebd8dbf55</gmapID>
<pics>[{'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipPcZEHxN2lv9tOorLTdgcWe7m4rzsszzXgbDv-Y=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipMhpH71IJY69XSN1eOme3SkfWetE9U1I7qHxP8A=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipMYfhtSLwK1EwY-IDNTuoRt33kijCMLfmp9jEoL=w150-h150-k-no-p']}]<//pics><user_name>Jeff Ballard< /user_name>< text>
Love local places like this. The diner is decorated nicely, kinda cowboy country house sort of feel. Got to talk to one of the owners about the menu and how the pulled pork was prepared, great stuff!

My two teenage boys had cowboy burgers. They loved em, ate em all up. They looked to me to have a good amount of char, thick pieces of bacon (cut nice to fit on the burger and not dangle out) and of course some melted cheese :)

I love pulled pork, so I went with the wrap. The smoky flavor was balanced nice with their Cole slaw. The pork did not have an overwhelming amount of smoked flavor. Their home made BBQ sauce went on it and paired wonderfully well. Their slaw is not runny which I prefer as well.

We all shared a larger order of onion rings and tried all three sauces. Soooo good. Event got some fries in there. They are not real thick, so a good amount of crunch which is what I like!

Full on soda fountain and I saw a couple sipping on bottled beer. I had complimentry water.

Definately a good place and worth the small drive out of the crowded city, take your kids. Gonna check out Ike's smokehouse in town later for the full smoked meat menu. I heard the ribs were awesome.

Go get your grub on!< /text>
</record></dataset><record>

<Name>Patrick Gorman<//Name><Date>1500003881908</Date><Rate>5< /Rate>< Review>
This place is awesome. Everytime I'm headed back to Shasta County from Chico, Marysville, or Sac I make a point to stop by. Great food, and amazing sun tea. After early spring the "EAT" sign is blocked by a tree heading north on 99. It's right after the first set of business on the right after the gun shop and drive through coffee- Code 3 (again- heading North on 99). Worth the U-turn of you miss it.</Review>

<user_id>107492637934285240379</user_id>< user_name>
Justin Kenward<//user_name>
< date>
1224344441597</date>
<rating>3<//rating>< Review>
This gay bar is much more low key then the VIP. I like it because it’s not trying to be a trendy gay bar. There’s music and a dance floor. But if your like me and aren’t much in to dancing there’s a back room that opens up to a patio. The music volume is much lower in the area. Making it a good place to talk to friends. Though even in the back you’ll need to speak loudly. Oh yah, there’s a short to no line and no cover charge. Even on Friday night.

There are things I don’t like. If you want a drink, you need to stand in a line at one of two cash registers. My friend and I got a seat at the bar and for well over 30 min the bartender kept saying, “I’ll be right with you guys.” I think it was about 45 min until we realized that if we wherever going to get a drink, we would have to stand in line. The other thing I didn’t like was the fact that the bartenders didn’t want to give drink recommendations and where kind of rude.

Other then that, it’s an okay gay bar with no cover charge. Key word being “no cover charge!”<//Review>

< review>
This is an acceptable bar through most of the week.  The Monday night karaoke is great, as are the drag shows and live musical performances they've started having.  However, I strongly recommend steering clear of it on Friday and Saturday nights.  At these times, it is completely overrun by neighboring bars' overflow of random straight people, many of whom are quite rude and pushy.  Pushy in a very literal sense.

On my last Friday night here, I was talking to a friend by the bar.  I got shoved towards the bar by a stream of people, including the bouncer.  I tried to brace myself with one hand against the bar, to politely keep myself from tumbling into the other people there.  This wasn't good enough, as I still ended up bumping shoulders with some dude who was there with his wife (ugh).  He then got all pissy, as if I'd just goosed him or something, and shoved me back (double ugh).

Straight people at a gay bar--fine.  Hundreds of straight people at a gay bar--whatever.  Hundreds of straight people, who often get weird & defensive about their heterosexuality--too much.

I kinda feel bad complaining about this, as it's not really the bar's fault.  Although it does have plenty of other shortcomings.  There is no happy hour, and the drinks are overpriced.  Although there is apparently a DJ, it seems there is just one default playlist; you are almost guaranteed to hear that "I'm Sexy and I Know It" song anytime you go.  And of course, some of the bouncers are jerks.  But the bartenders are generally pleasant and doing their best.  The location is great, in lovely and increasingly lively downtown Riverside (though this is both a blessing and a curse).  And I can't help but have affection for it--it is after all one of only two gay bars in town.  I just wish it were better.  And I swear (this time I mean it for real!), I will never ever go there on a Friday or Saturday again.  You probably don't want to either.< /review>

<Text>My frist time reclying for cash
Here what you need to know..they don't want the cap on any thing ..2. They don't take anything with out the California redemption bar or code...for example wine and liquor bottles are a NO!
Most Bottles are clear or brown keep them separate. Park your vehicle then go get the garbage bin to put your recycling into separate them..push them up to the weight station..then go to the cashier for payment...must bring ID<//Text>< pictures>

< user>
109753634679424429168<//user>
<username>Mikhail Trubin<//username>< Date>
1515652845107</Date>
< rating>
4<//rating>
< Review>
I always recycle copper and brass at Circossa metal in San Francisco. But I wanted to try a local place.
Well experience was mostly nice. Staff are frendly. If you have business licence, or contractor licence they will pay out right away, if not it’s a 3 day hold. Prices seemed a bit lower then my other place, but not going to SF makes up for it. Something I was not awere of: there is copper #3, for some reason they counted my waste as #3. While other places would always count it as #2.
So if you have under 200lbs bring it in, if you have way more Circossa might pay out more.
Good luck.</Review>
<pics>None< /pics>< response>
None</response>

Thy Hua<//username>
<time>1565906814435<//time><rating>1< /rating>< text>
Their boba is decent but it’s too pricey for a cup of boba. It’s almost $7 whenever I buy and I don’t think it’s worth it that much. In addition to that, I hear that they add water to top off your boba if you don’t tip, and I really can taste that difference. For a $7 boba, I think that’s a jerk move, not worth the money and time.< /text>
<Pictures>None< /Pictures><response>None< /response><Gmap_id>0x809ac7e01deb0a49:0x3b1c7396ffa32800</Gmap_id></record>

<userid>102369733394698345145</userid>< Name>
Stephanie Moris</Name>
< time>
1566308142871<//time>
< Rating>
5< /Rating>
< text>
Years ago, I used to jokingly say that a certain coffee brand could be found on every corner, but this actually seems to be the case when it comes to boba locations nowadays.

Well, while boba is a commonly found item in Elk Grove, boba that is made from scratch is not. I've been here numerous times: prior to their official opening, on their grand opening day, and many times after.

Customer service is always friendly. While their drinks are definitely on the pricier side to, I'm someone that believes in quality over quantity. The sizes of the cups are not as small as some as their competitors as well.

I was pretty sad that they replaced their Taro Sago flavor with Coconut Taro, but I've yet to be disappointed by any of their drinks. I usually stick to one or two flavors at a boba place, but at Teacup I can pick anything that sounds good to me and not regret it (so far). Out of all the drinks I've tried, my personal favorites are the Citrus Mango and Strawberry Fruit Tea.

Looking forward to trying more drink options and revisiting my favorites!< /text>

<user_id>113698437492347551460< /user_id>< user_name>
Ian M</user_name>
<time>1559243543759< /time><rating>5<//rating>< text>
This is a nice park. There are lots of people that use it for the basketball court and the swing sets and jungle gym. I've seen quite a few games of Sandman being played. The Parks and Rec staff keep close eyes on their kids, and the baseball field merges into other open areas as well as the paths along the surrounding waterways.
A library branch finishes the setup, making this a very nice public space.< /text>

<userid>101457460921343625921</userid><user_name>Ed Schmollinger<//user_name><Date>1562613027309<//Date><Rating>4<//Rating><Review>this is a quiet park next to a small library and strip mall. the main attraction is a small, fenced playground for smaller children which is often overrun by the daycare next door. nearby, you will find a baseball field, tennis courts, and basketball hoops.

the park is well-maintained and has a mix of shady/sunny and flat/mounded areas. there are a handful of picnic tables, but no grills.

the park is right next to mccartney street, and there is no fence, so you might choose to be concerned about your ball, frisbee, or child finding its way into traffic.<//Review>< Pics>

<Rating>4<//Rating><Review>Leydecker park, you're a family friend
Got ballers, kids, grass, but for parking you'll need to fend
The playground is nice, not too shabby
There's also a full basketball court in case you're flabby

This park is pretty nice.  Has a playground for kids, large round field for things like ultimate frisbee, has a full basketball court, and a softball field.  The only thing is, that if there's an event, good luck finding parking.  Parking can be tough to get without an event going on.  Otherwise, a nice park.  Just make sure kids cross the street safely around here.< /Review>< pictures>

TL;DR I brought my car here for a simple battery change service and ended up with a totaled car. I would not recommend coming to this dealership.

I brought my car to the dealership for a battery change. It took more than a month for them to complete the service. Given that the service was done during Covid-19, this delay was understandable. HOWEVER, when I went to pick up the car, I found that the flooring under the back passenger seats was completely flooded with water. The water had seeped through the panels and damaged the internal parts of the car. As a result, my car had to be totaled. Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek refused to take responsibility for this negligence. I will not be returning to this dealership and would highly discourage people from getting their cars serviced here.< /review>

<Review>Overall it was a bad experience. I had my windshield broken and needed to be replaced. At the beginning they didn't check the glass need to be ordered and there was no estimation of delivery due to COVID, they asked me to leave my car to them and gave me a loaner car (with a lots of dust inside). I drove the loaner for almost 2 weeks and I needed to keep calling back to them to check the status of the glass (they never gave me any updates during that time!). Finally I had to ask them to give the car back to me first.
Afterwards, I keep calling them to check the status of glass delivery. They never contact me although they said they will. Finally the glass was there and I made an appointment over the phone. However, when I showed up on my appointment, they could not find my name on the list. I am very sure that I went there at the correct time, but they kind of joked me on that to imply I remembered a wrong time for my service. At the end I need to put my car at the dealer overnight although they promised me at the beginning that the job can be done at the same day.
On the day I picked up my car, more crazy things happened that my m-benz APP kept telling me that my car battery became extremely bad (reaching critical condition) and they put the tire pressure ridiculous high as 52 psi (normal max. setting in manual is 43 psi). When I reflected these issues to them they just said as long as the alarming lights are not ON, you should be fine. However, I have never had this kind of experience at other dealer shop. And I need to pay extra time to make my car back in normal.
Although they did replaced my windshield successfully, the service representative was not honest on the situation and totally not responsible to the whole process. Also they don't take good care of your car after service and even put your tire or battery into improper conditions. Will not go back to this place again.

<rating>1</rating>< Review>
Due to Covid-19 my SLC43 was driven less than 1,700 miles for the 1st service. Ethan was the service manager with quick and fancy talk. Without realizing he put alignment as part of the service. I didn't complain about steering nor the tire had any worn mark. Basically he is bilking. He left message that the alignment was out of the spec. B.S.! The alignment test sheet showed only two items that he considered out of spec: the rear toe was 0.13 when the spec is 0.34 +/- 0.14 (0.1 ~ 0.44, so within the spec), the front toe (pressed) was 0.14 when the spec is 0.09 +/- 0.05 (0.04 ~ 0.14, still within the spec). If you must bring your Mercedes to this place, make sure  you check every items before you sign. I would suggest choose other place for the service. Basically I paid over $900 for the oil-change.<//Review>

<name>Brian English</name><rating>1<//rating>< resp>
None<//resp>
<gmapID>0x808fca855c879807:0xa6eb059ea5b89798</gmapID>< Review>
Went to see an RS5 for a good price -- lady on the phone knew I was travelling an hour to see the car, and we did a credit check before I arrived.

The car had clearly been in an undisclosed front accident. Passenger side of the hood dipped much lower and you could see the height difference clearly. Next to the poor fit from a head on collision was condensation from the passenger headlight, also from the undisclosed front end collision. The poor hood fit was also happening on the right side, but not as bad. Probably was hit on the passenger left side. Look closely around the headlight pic I took and you can see the passenger fender panel also mis-aligned, it is sticking over the headlight in a funky way. I included photos, unfortunately I didn't take photos of the hood mis-alignment, was in a rush and not planning to buy the car.

I started the car and it had a Differential fault. Engine bay had non-factory welds in it, plastic trim that was falling out, missing screws, absolutely embarrassing overall that Mercedes offered this car to the public in this condition. There was also a very old "clear bra" on the car, which you'd have to pay to remove, and it looked awful. None of this mentioned or viewable in the ad.

Basically they are counting on a buyer who is really clueless about cars or someone so overwhelmed with the idea of an RS5 that they overlook the front end issues -- some days the condensation I saw wouldn't be there.

Poorly repaired front accident cars have hidden expenses that will go on and on, and the front end can never really be fixed perfectly. It's basically buying a salvaged car that doesn't have the title. Someone hid this accident, probably was owned by someone affiliated by the dealership, then dumped on the public.

Summary: Car was advertised as having no accidents, none on the carfax, however visual inspection showed a clear, undisclosed front-end accident. 100% unmistakable that this car was in an accident and Mercedes is lying about it. If they can't spot the accident on this car, they should not be in business -- there's no way they don't know.

Scammers who wasted my day off, 2 hours in a car, and the cost of 2 Lyfts because I expected to buy the car -- It was a "reputable" dealership after all!</Review>

<Review>You should expect better, and more; after all we 're talking Mercedes Benz, right?  Well, they certainly delivered.  Mr Stephen Kirksey and his team were meticulous, responsive, understanding and resourceful.  I came in with a 4K miles' car (almost new!) that had a rattling sound in the dashboard that seemed only possible on a 104K miles car!  I was actually quite worried and bothered with my big purchase (I never owned a MB before).  They unassembled my AMG GLE 63S searching for that "cricket" and kept it longer than they had told me they would (which worried me even more), but they kept me informed and up to date with what was happening until they found a bunch of coins rattling in the inside of my car (I certainly do not know how they got there!).  I have a quiet, now truly pleasurable ride at last and what is best, although this kind of thing should've not been covered by warranty, like it or not those were my coins, they still covered the many hours of labor charging me nothing!  Customer Service is a dying breed, we all know that, but it is very refreshing to see that it still remains alive and well at Steven's Creek MB.<//Review>< pictures>

<review>My service advisor, John, deserves 5 stars. Dropping off the car took a bit longer than expected due to many cars in the queue ( I got there ~7 minutes prior to my appointment). Once the line cleared, check-in process was easy, and the service advisor took very good care of me.
I'd used Smythe to service my car routinely - they even replaced the transmission. I went to an independent shop once the dealership changed ownership.
This was the second time I had my car serviced at Mercedes of Stevens Creek - both major. One to fix the convertible top mechanism that was stuck in the open position, and most recently, to fix the driver's seat motor. Both times, the car came back worse than when I took it in.
In the process of fixing the convertible top mechanism, they manage to rip the top (it was the original top); however, since I took the car in with the top in the open position, I could not prove the dealership had damaged it. I replaced the top subsequently.
The most recent service included the seat motor replacement, new tires, 4 wheel alignment, suspension work, and new steering shock. After the service, I can feel a distinct vibration in steering where there was none previously. I took it back to the dealership. Again the service advisor took very good care of me. He had the shop foreman check out the car, and rebalance the tires, re-check all the work, tighten everything to spec. He told me this is pretty much everything that can be done. I noted the vibration is still present; he maintains this is normal for the car (it is not based on my experience prior to the service). It feels like at least one of the tires may be out of round.
-------------------------
Update March 18, 2021: MB of Stevens Creek contacted me and asked to bring the car back. They replaced the tire that was out of round and rechecked the other related items. The ride is improved. I'm very happy with their customer service.<//review>< Pics>

<rate>2< /rate><GmapID>0x808fca855c879807:0xa6eb059ea5b89798< /GmapID>< review>
I have been visiting MB of Stevens Creek for past 5 years, but the last servicing experience was particularly poor.
To begin with with I was handed over an estimate of 670 /wo taxes when I scheduled my servicing, however when I reached there the agent told me that the car is eligible for 70K/7yr servicing (even if there were only 60K miles, and it was just over 6+ yr) and hence * I would have to * take the 70K/7yr service AND also change the transmission fluids. I tried to ask him if I can reduce some optional components of the service to reduce my bill, but he flatly denied and told me that unless I do all that he is mentioning, they will not reset the service indicator on the car. So I agreed to get 70K/7yr service and transmission fluid change.
When I finally came to pick up my car, I was surprised to find that they had billed me +$1200, and included additional charges for even things as trivial as +$6 for remote battery (just to note, I don't mind this, but in all previous years, almost all 5 servicing, the service-assistants have been kind enough to do this without charging), and it included several other replacement charges and coolant charges...
I tried to ask more details about $700+ charge which said 70K/7yr service, but there was no one to explain the components of that service. I was surprised that besides the 70K/7yr service they had charged so many other additional charges...
I have been coming to MB of Stevens Creek every year, but this time I felt that the overall experience was poor and attitude of the service specialist was not very welcoming. Hence the low rating. I hope someone pays attention to this.< /review>

<Review>Our (my wife and I) overall experience at the Stevens Creek Mercedes-Benz dealership was very good. They are really motivated to get your business if you make an informed & mutually win-win offer (vs ripping you off).

The only reason for 4 STARS vs 5 STARS is that due to a certain misunderstanding, we lost the first vehicle that we were interested in. In going back and forth on the lease discussion with the Sales person, the actual numbers (MF, RV...) on the lease were not provided early on in the discussion which resulted in us walking. It was only after few days speaking with Chris (their senior manager) that we understood the disconnect in our numbers vs theirs. By then the vehicle was sold. The second time around we met with Basir Ahmadi via Val and we closed the deal in 30 minutes. Basir Ahmadi went out of his way to ensure that we were treated well. We even left our vehicle in their lot for a week as we drove with the new vehicle and came back a week later to pick up our existing vehicle.

Our experience with Moshtaba, the finance person was also very good. We did not experience sales pressure for unwanted items. He even went out of his way to get us a great deal on the pre-paid maintenance and permaplate warranty as part of our lease agreement.

In summary, we strongly recommend this dealership and we would again provide our business to Stevens Creek dealership when opportunity arises. Chris, Val, Basir Ahmadi and Moshtaba are the folks that we interacted with during our second round of engagement. Thank you.<//Review>< name>

1615859184646< /time>
<Rating>5< /Rating><text>My wife and I had the best experience purchasing a new car at a dealership that we have ever had in more than 40 years. Like most people, we dread going to a dealer as they play games to make you wait for them to "evaluate" your offer, and then come back and make you feel bad for wanting to get a good price. Not with Slava Aprelenko at MB of Stevens Creek. From the first time we met with him and he walked us through the ordering process because the model we wanted was not in stock, he was honest and open and recommended a few items that we should consider, and for other ones, said we really didn't need that feature. He gave us a very fair quote and then kept us appraised of the delivery process, always making sure that we were still feeling good about the order. When it finally arrived he spent quite a bit of time with us to make sure we really liked the car and wanted to complete the deal. He then spent over an hour with me explaining all the features. After that, we met Dusan Golomeio, who did all the paperwork and contract information. Dusan was just as helpful and honest as Slava, and by the time we were done with the transaction, we were not wiped out and feeling dirty. We will absolutely be back to purchase other vehicles from Slava and Dusan, and highly recommend them and MB of Stevens Creek as a great way to purchase a car, and get a very fair deal.</text><pictures>None<//pictures>< response>

< Review>
I had an excellent experience at Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek.

I worked with Sales Consultant Basir Ahmadi who later brought in the General Sales Manager Christopher Hong.

Both Basir and Christopher were professional, friendly and helped me come to a decision that put me in a fabulous car at a price and agreement that I felt comfortable and happy with. I cannot say enough good things about these two genuinely great humans!

I highly recommend requesting either of these two for your sales needs.

The team members I met in finance only added to my great experience.

The knowledgeable and kind Sean Shah took the time to help me understand aspects of my finance agreement in such a clear easy way to understand.

I then met with Moe Afschar to go over and sign  the final paperwork. Moe assisted me in my understanding of the various warranties and protections available to me. He explained the paperwork with extreme clarity and was committed to addressing my questions during the process.

Assisted by Moe’s excellent communication skills, knowledge of products policies and finance we were able to successfully complete my paperwork in a breeze.

If you’re headed to Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek I hope that you have an experience as wonderful as mine was and are able to work with at least one of the team members I mentioned in my review 😊

***UPDATE: SERVICE DEPARTMENT***

Shout out to my Service Representative Ethan Kurtz! He’s the best! I don’t know quite how to sum it up, but request him as your Service Representative and you will get why I say he’s the best.

Ethan’s work ethic is tops! He is thorough and quick: Quick to respond, quick to evaluate the issue at hand, thorough in explaining the issue and how to solve it.

On top of the great professionalism I’ve experienced at Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek by Ethan, he is such a nice person!

Ethan’s genuine kindness and professionalism are the reason why I will continue to have my car services done at MB of Stevens Creek even though I will be moving closer to a different dealership.

I figure the caliber of work as far as mechanics etc are all up to the MB standard, but finding a great service representative is hit or miss.

I hope Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek is able to recognize a gem like Ethan Kurtz!</Review>

< text>
What a pleasant surprise...  I am 60yo and have purchased many many vehicles from both Dealerships as well as Private parties.  And I have to say this was the BEST Buying experience ever.  I Purchased a very inexpensive car but the Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek dealership treated me as if I was buying one of their Top of the Line automobiles.

The Salesperson Jim Chassebi  was so patient with me and my daughter.  It was her first purchase and she was both excided and nervous at the same time. She's heading off to Nursing School and  Jim wanted to make sure she had a safe and reliable car... He was awesome.  We felt no pressure and a sense of calmness and casualness. I have already told almost a dozen of my friends about the AutoNation Experience and especially that of Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek.

I don't normally give 5 stars in reviews, because I believe they should be reserved for the Very Very Best performance.  But I just can't think of AutoNation and Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek doing anything more to satisfy their customers.

sincerly,

Joe K.
of San Jose, Ca.

< Review>
Overall, the service performed was good. The amount was incredibly excessive and most not necessary.
My service agent was Angela and she was exceptional. The driver that delivered my vehicle could not have been better and more personable. The people I dealt with were fantastic.
I have owned Mercedes Benz since 1992 covering nine different models. I have worked for Mercedes Benz and have always loved their vehicles. However since now the price gouging on service has driven me away to Tesla. I am now down to my last Mercedes I’ll ever own or gas powered car I’ll ever own. <Date>1606284526316</Date><Rate>2<//Rate>< text>
I had a simple service appointment to which I showed up on time, but I had to wait over 30 minutes for the service advisor to come to my car to write up the order. It was not a busy time. Once I was finally signed in, I chose to wait for my car to be serviced, because it should be relatively quick. After a reasonable time, the service advisor advised me my car was getting washed and would be brought up in about 5-10 minutes. Good, things were looking up. I was instructed my car would be brought up at the end of the service aisle where I should wait. After more than 20 minutes passed standing outside waiting, I approached the counter and asked the counter man again what was the delay? He checked the computer again and informed me my service advisor must have forgotten to tell them to bring up the car. It was parked in the garage. It took him another 10 minutes to walk out to wherever the car was to bring it up. That meant I wasted at least another 30 minutes just waiting after the service was complete. In total, MB wasted my time for over an hour. I was even told when I voiced my displeasure at the disrespect I endured that, "sometimes it takes longer when customers choose to wait!" On what planet does that make sense?</text>

<text>Very expensive service without commensurate quality of service. Just spent $2,000 on service and they say they want another $2,100 to replace the entire intake manifold due to a plastic part wearing out. There are no messages on the dash and the car drives very well so I declined.

I had a battery drain issue, had to replace the battery twice in 2 months. After 3 days of diagnosis they couldn’t find any issue. Of course I had to pay for the diagnosis regardless. Now 10 days later the battery is dead again. A few years ago when they put in a new battery I now discovered that they omitted the vent tube so the gases of the battery can go outside the hood. No wonder I had weird smells inside the car since the inlet for outside air is right on top of the battery. This was discovered by the AAA guy who came and replaced the dead Mercedes battery.

Another issue cropped up after the last service. The technician damaged the left hood strut so now when I open the hood it doesn’t stay up. It was fine right before I took it in. I know that because I opened the hood to jump start the battery.

They used to be a lot better and more reasonable before. I had been servicing 3 cars for the last 15 years there. Now it’s all about how they can charge more and more. I think the good mechanics are gone and there is a lot of pressure from management for revenue. Terrible.<//text></record></dataset><record>

I was very happy with the communication I received, especially having my car towed from another shop that had my car for over 2 weeks and I received hardly any communication from them. <Rate>1<//Rate>< text>
Sales Misrepresentation at Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek

Our vehicle, the 2018 Mercedes Benz C300, finished its first pre-paid maintenance at Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek last week. However, yesterday was the first time that we know there is a three-year expiration date for our pre-paid maintenance package.

The vehicle was purchased in 2018 at Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek. When we were discussing whether we should purchase the pre-paid maintenance plan, we raised the issue of what if we can not drive 10,000 miles per year and we can not finish three maintenance in three years. The salesperson explicitly told us: "It's a common misunderstanding that the customer believes they have to use the prepaid package in three years. It's actually not true. The package can be used as long as the mileage of the vehicle does not reach 30,000 miles." With the trust of the salesperson and the brand of Mercedes Benz, we believed this and purchased the package. Coincidentally, we did not drive much during the pandemic. It took our vehicle two years to reach 10,000 miles. Last week, Susan from the service department told us that there is an expiration date for our pre-paid maintenance package. Now we think this is a misrepresentation that happened during our vehicle purchase procedure.

We have contacted Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek and hope to solve this issue. None of them have worked. We are disappointed with the service of Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek and the misrepresentation during the purchase of our vehicle.

Maybe it's time to consider a Tesla for our next car. They are fully transparent and honest after all.</text>

<username>Shiyu Song< /username>< Text>
Sales Misrepresentation at Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek

Our vehicle, the 2018 Mercedes Benz C300, finished its first pre-paid maintenance at Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek last week. However, yesterday was the first time that we know there is a three-year expiration date for our pre-paid maintenance package.

The vehicle was purchased in 2018 at Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek. When we were discussing whether we should purchase the pre-paid maintenance plan, we raised the issue of what if we can not drive 10,000 miles per year and we can not finish three maintenance in three years. The salesperson explicitly told us: "It's a common misunderstanding that the customer believes they have to use the prepaid package in three years. It's actually not true. The package can be used as long as the mileage of the vehicle does not reach 30,000 miles." With the trust of the salesperson and the brand of Mercedes Benz, we believed this and purchased the package. Coincidentally, we did not drive much during the pandemic. It took our vehicle two years to reach 10,000 miles. Last week, Susan from the service department told us that there is an expiration date for our pre-paid maintenance package. Now we think this is a misrepresentation that happened during our vehicle purchase procedure.

We have contacted Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek and hope to solve this issue. None of them have worked. We are disappointed with the service of Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek and the misrepresentation during the purchase of our vehicle.

Maybe it's time to consider a Tesla for our next car. They are fully transparent and honest after all.</Text>

< text>

<UserId.>112319527569631772380<//UserId.>< user_name>
Greg Hansen</user_name>
<date>1588795791730<//date><rate>1<//rate><Review>I am the recent owner of a 2009 C63. I received my vehicle on Monday, 4/27, and it was love at first sight.

I called the local dealership, Mercedes-Benz Steven's Creek, and scheduled an inspection and the factory recall for the airbag. I dropped the vehicle off Thursday, 4/30 at 2pm, and picked up the vehicle Friday, 5/1 at 4pm.

Upon sitting in my vehicle and feeling the steering wheel, I immediately noticed that it made a "knocking sound" if you slightly rotated the wheel back and forth. This did not exist before I dropped off my vehicle.

I immediately parked the vehicle and went back inside to find my Service Adviser, Susan Sulimani. I informed her of the problem, my concern, and we scheduled a follow-up for Monday 5/4 at 9am.

On the way home, the driving was worse. The entire steering was off. The knocking was in the wheel, the steering wheel felt loose or like it had slop in it, there was a disconnectedness from the steering wheel to the road, and when adjusting the steering wheel tilt column there was a loud "crunch" sound. Even worse, the steering wheel locked up and got tight as I was entering the on-ramp of a freeway. I thought I was going to go into a guardrail.

I emailed Susan Friday, 5/1 evening and told her my follow-up concerns. She only offered a loaner car, no expedited service.

I dropped off my C63 to the dealership, they confirmed the knocking, and said they didn't do it. I spoke with the Service Director, Randy, and in his anger and frustration, he walked out of our conversation. I want my car fixed like how I dropped it off.

One of the other issues I brought up is that the service adviser said my tires were close to replacement. What makes that surprising is that the tires currently on the car are only 1 week old. When I brought this up, she defended her recommendation, said, "well, I don't know what kind of tires they sold you". We went outside, measured the tires, sure enough they were like-new and had green tread ware. She didn't apologize, only said she would remove the recommendation.</Review>< Pics>
None</Pics>

<Name>Greg Hansen</Name>< Resp>
{'time': 1588858929548, 'text': "Greg, we regret your experience with us here, but are glad you brought this to our attention. We'd like the opportunity to make this up to you, so if you're willing, please contact our General Manager at (408) 641-4610. We hope to hear from you."}<//Resp>
< text>
I am the recent owner of a 2009 C63. I received my vehicle on Monday, 4/27, and it was love at first sight.

I called the local dealership, Mercedes-Benz Steven's Creek, and scheduled an inspection and the factory recall for the airbag. I dropped the vehicle off Thursday, 4/30 at 2pm, and picked up the vehicle Friday, 5/1 at 4pm.

Upon sitting in my vehicle and feeling the steering wheel, I immediately noticed that it made a "knocking sound" if you slightly rotated the wheel back and forth. This did not exist before I dropped off my vehicle.

I immediately parked the vehicle and went back inside to find my Service Adviser, Susan Sulimani. I informed her of the problem, my concern, and we scheduled a follow-up for Monday 5/4 at 9am.

On the way home, the driving was worse. The entire steering was off. The knocking was in the wheel, the steering wheel felt loose or like it had slop in it, there was a disconnectedness from the steering wheel to the road, and when adjusting the steering wheel tilt column there was a loud "crunch" sound. Even worse, the steering wheel locked up and got tight as I was entering the on-ramp of a freeway. I thought I was going to go into a guardrail.

I emailed Susan Friday, 5/1 evening and told her my follow-up concerns. She only offered a loaner car, no expedited service.

I dropped off my C63 to the dealership, they confirmed the knocking, and said they didn't do it. I spoke with the Service Director, Randy, and in his anger and frustration, he walked out of our conversation. I want my car fixed like how I dropped it off.

One of the other issues I brought up is that the service adviser said my tires were close to replacement. What makes that surprising is that the tires currently on the car are only 1 week old. When I brought this up, she defended her recommendation, said, "well, I don't know what kind of tires they sold you". We went outside, measured the tires, sure enough they were like-new and had green tread ware. She didn't apologize, only said she would remove the recommendation.<//text>

< user_id>
109050664578663785162</user_id>
<Name>Abdullah Chaudhry</Name><time>1591345033079</time><Rating>1</Rating>< review>
Bought my Mercedes and Prepaid Maintenance from Mercedes Benz Stevens Creek, a year ago. After a whole year, I booked my first appointment for Oil change on a Saturday. This was going to be my 1st experience with Service Department of Mercedes Benz Stevens Creek. I requested a loaner vehicle with my appointment.

Rodrigo was my service advisor. He said that my car would be ready within 4 hours and told me to bring back the loaner the same day before 3pm, otherwise I would be charged per day. When I got the loaner vehicle, the documentation clearly stated that car needs to be returned by Monday morning.

At around 2pm on Saturday, Rodrigo called me and asked me to collect my car and drop off the loaner. When I told him that normally a customer has 24 hours notice period, he started yelling at me " I told you to return it today before 3pm". Furthermore, he started harassing me by saying that now I would be charged for a day. I told him "Lets discuss when we meet" to which he said that there is nothing to discuss and hung up.

Then, he called me back after 15 mins and said" I've checked with loaner department, you do have 24 hours. Now you have to return the loaner vehicle tomorrow (Sunday) by 3pm." I asked him if the dealership was open on Sunday. He said: "No but I am appointing someone for you"
By time time, I started feeling very uncomfortable and couldn't believe a Mercedes Benz Dealership would treat its customer like a fugitive. Loaner Department gave me a receipt which clearly mentioned Return day as Monday morning 10am.

Monday morning when I went to pick up my car, I had to involve the management to let them know about my absolutely devastating experience. While I was waiting in the car lot right next to my car, Rodrigo set off the car alarm with key remote and slowly walked towards me. The alarm kept sounding to which I was shocked how disrespectful an employee could be. As he approached me, there were no greetings. He straight away asked me" Did you get your paperwork?" I told him that I didn't. He said: "you will get it from the office".

My service advisor was deceitful and lacked basic customer service skills. Overall, I had a terrible experience. A roadside mechanic shop would have treated its customer better.. I have already requested to cancel different service packages that I bought with my car as I dont think I would be going back to Mercedes Benz Stevens Creek again.</review>

We look forward to hearing from you soon.'}</Response><GmapID>0x808fca855c879807:0xa6eb059ea5b89798</GmapID></record></dataset><record>

<Name>Abdullah Chaudhry<//Name><Time>1591345033079<//Time><Rating>1< /Rating>< text>
Bought my Mercedes and Prepaid Maintenance from Mercedes Benz Stevens Creek, a year ago. After a whole year, I booked my first appointment for Oil change on a Saturday. This was going to be my 1st experience with Service Department of Mercedes Benz Stevens Creek. I requested a loaner vehicle with my appointment.

Rodrigo was my service advisor. He said that my car would be ready within 4 hours and told me to bring back the loaner the same day before 3pm, otherwise I would be charged per day. When I got the loaner vehicle, the documentation clearly stated that car needs to be returned by Monday morning.

At around 2pm on Saturday, Rodrigo called me and asked me to collect my car and drop off the loaner. When I told him that normally a customer has 24 hours notice period, he started yelling at me " I told you to return it today before 3pm". Furthermore, he started harassing me by saying that now I would be charged for a day. I told him "Lets discuss when we meet" to which he said that there is nothing to discuss and hung up.

Then, he called me back after 15 mins and said" I've checked with loaner department, you do have 24 hours. Now you have to return the loaner vehicle tomorrow (Sunday) by 3pm." I asked him if the dealership was open on Sunday. He said: "No but I am appointing someone for you"
By time time, I started feeling very uncomfortable and couldn't believe a Mercedes Benz Dealership would treat its customer like a fugitive. Loaner Department gave me a receipt which clearly mentioned Return day as Monday morning 10am.

Monday morning when I went to pick up my car, I had to involve the management to let them know about my absolutely devastating experience. While I was waiting in the car lot right next to my car, Rodrigo set off the car alarm with key remote and slowly walked towards me. The alarm kept sounding to which I was shocked how disrespectful an employee could be. As he approached me, there were no greetings. He straight away asked me" Did you get your paperwork?" I told him that I didn't. He said: "you will get it from the office".

My service advisor was deceitful and lacked basic customer service skills. Overall, I had a terrible experience. A roadside mechanic shop would have treated its customer better.. I have already requested to cancel different service packages that I bought with my car as I dont think I would be going back to Mercedes Benz Stevens Creek again.</text>

<review>The low score is for the terrible service at pick-up.  After finishing the paper work, I was told that my car would be out soon. I waited and waited, but it took more than 20 minutes before my car finally came out..... unwashed. Since a complementary car wash was promised by my advisor, I asked them to wash it. It would be another 30 minutes before they came out with my washed car.

I want to emphasize that while I was waiting there weren't many other customers. In fact, I was the only one there by the time I sent them back for the car wash. Understandably a car wash takes time, but 30 minutes was unreasonable.

All in all, Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek made me wait ~50 minutes just to pick up my car.  A horrible experience.

Update on 6/10/2020: Just when you think their service can’t get worse, it does. On 6/8/2020, I took up the offer in their reply below to call their GM, and I left a message for him/her to call me back. Surprise surprise, I never got a call back. To Mercedes of Stevens Creek: if you don’t want to make things right, don’t bother posting here just for show.< /review>< Pictures>

< Review>
We're Audi owners, used to own Mercedes in the late 80s and early 90s. Since there's no high line EV's except the B class and i3, we found our 2015 B class here on Auto trader for our mother. Slava was a great sales consultant, professional, patient and extremely knowledgeable about MBZ. We went back 3 times before we made our decision to purchase the car. Yes, I wore shorts and t-shirt and Slava still let me to test drive the car LOL. Since it's a used 1 price car, no negotiation or anything like that, everything went peacefully and stress-less. One thing wasn't done correctly was the day running lights were turned off, and when we came home to turn it on, one wasn't on, we had to bring it back for fixing. Troy was nice to take care of it, but this should happen if the technician who smog and safety this car did his job correctly, to me, I felt cheated regardless if it's an honest mistake, but all day running lights should be turned on. Anyhow, due to Slava and Troy performance, I still give 5 stars. For other customers, make sure to turn on everything before taking delivery, yes, it's under warranty, but taking it back, waiting for service is totally uncalled for.< /Review>

I said, not only did you not come over to get me but you also didn't send an email either, so I could have been waiting forever without being notified. Got my car serviced here. Overall the service was good. The staff were friendly and helpful. However, I'm giving a 2 stars for two reasons:

1)  When I asked the service manager overseeing my car when was the latest time I could pickup my car that evening he told me 5:45pm. I had to leave work midway through a meeting and rush to pickup my car only to have the lady at the customer service desk tell me the service center actually closes at 6:30pm not 5:45pm. Why would the service manager feel the need to lie about pick up times?

2) The next day I noticed one of the tire valve caps was missing from my car and called the service center. Instead of being apologetic or offering a replacement cap the lady on the phone informed me that the cost for a plastic valve cap was $3 and if I wanted a specialty valve cap that would be $20 for a set... I brought my car in with 4 tire valve caps and came out from my car service with only 3 and she has the gall to try to charge me for something they messed up. <review>Edit: So I called the # the dealership provided in the response. Then I called again, after multiple transfers, service part answered that they even don't have the plug for the holes. Ok I will DIY. Edit 2: A small round smudge on the driver side window (inside) is found the next day of the new car pick up (which was at 8 pm, my bad that I said yes). The smudge is confirmed that cannot be removed today in a window tint shop. Don't bother to contact them again but this is disappointing.

<Rating>5<//Rating>< text>
I have been a customer, for several new cars and service, at Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek (and Smyth European, the former name of this dealership) since 1997.  That's because the service, quality of all the staff, and vehicles themselves have been consistently excellent.
This visit was for 40K service and while all the work was done in a timely and thorough fashion, technicians discovered two additional problems, both of which were covered under warranty and would take additional time so I was provided a free loaner vehicle for two days.
I recommend Tony Spencer, as the most knowledgable, helpful and thoroughly prepared to assist sales person.
Over the years the service technician, Felix, engaged me in a friendly, informative fashion, took extra time to provide not just info about the service work, but also additional suggestions about vehicle maintenance going forward.  He is professional, thorough, and works to make YOU feel a part of his team to take care of your car.
THANKS!< /text>

<review>BEWARE - they do not take responsibility if anything happens to your vehicle during servicing. Take thorough photos before and after to make sure nothing is out of the ordinary.

Took my car in for servicing due to an airbag recall. Didn't want anything else done to the vehicle and made it very clear. Should have been a simple fix. Dropped it off in the morning and came back 6 hours later to pick it up.
The car was returned to me in with filth all over the tires, as if they drove it through a dirt road and did not clean it at all. I put brand new Michelin tires on the vehicle and admitted the car in the morning with the tires in perfect condition, but they were returned covered in dirt and dust as if they were 5 year old tires.
My right side rear view mirror light was also broken, which was working perfectly fine when I admitted the car in the morning. There was also a small bump on the mirror casing, which makes it seem that they bumped it with a service cart or something of sorts. There is a new warning on my dashboard that was not there when I admitted the car in the morning, which was confirmed by my service records that states there was no "service light" warning.
Spoke to the assistant manager which also brought out his manager and none of them would take any responsibility for the condition and damage they have caused. Albeit a small inconvenience, they just kept saying "I don't know how it became like this and I don't know what happened."
I simply don't trust them enough to bring my car back here and I don't want them touching my car again.</review>< pictures>

(Suggestion 1: have the cashier ask the customer if he or she is ready to pick up the car and have the car ordered up immediately electronically.) Next the guy shows up, looks at my paper work, tells me he will pull up the car right away “here.” The implication is that I should wait there.  I did. I have purchased a 2017 Mercedes Benz C300 CPO last week and it was delivered to me on Monday by Aramais Bagdasaryan on his day off. How about that for a customer service? Stevens Creek Mercedes is a top notch dealership including Kevin Sitch GM whose number one priority is a "HAPPY" customer! The communication between dealer and customer is second to none. I got the car what l wanted and could not be happier. Aramais is a great salesman with a smile! No pressure, just great service!
Overall my hats off to Stevens Creek Mercedes and thank you for a great experience purchasing a new vehicle. Also wanted to mention their great financial people Samir Karimi and Nicolas Kith for their polite, prompt communications.
BTW their COVID 19 response is great and felt safe all the time while buying the vehicle.
Definitely coming back for my next ride in the future!

<Name>Eryn Arzate</Name><Date>1571147829497<//Date><rate>1<//rate>< text>
I’d like to update my review and completely change it. While test driving the car I bought I pointed out to the salesmen, Alex, that the “service now” light was on. He assured me it would be taken care of. Proceeded with the paper and while signing again, brought up the light and again told it would be taken care of and to bring the car back next week and they’d reset it.

I brought the car back the following Thursday to have them turn the light off to which the head of the used cars told me they were unable to do due to not being “certified Audi mechanics”, um ok cool, but if you are certified why did you do the work to begin with, especially if you can’t finish the job??

I the proceed to call the Audi dealer because there was also a recall in the car that wasn’t taken care if and they tell me that they'll do the light for me but it will cost $80 and considering I just bought the car and it has a warranty Mercedes should be paying.

Then I call my salesman, Alex, again and he calls me back and his solution to my problem is to just drive the car with the light and then have it reset. Seriously? He said he’d talk to his boss and call me back. Fast forward 5 days and 2 phone calls later I still haven’t heard from them.

I took my car to Audi and not only were they the nicest people at a car dealership  I have ever seen after hearing how badly I was treated by Mercedes they reset my light for free.

So unless you are ready to drop a couple hundred grand a car, you will get no respect or service from these people.</text>

< gmap_id>
0x808fca855c879807:0xa6eb059ea5b89798< /gmap_id>
</record>
</dataset><record>
< text>
Went to get my car serviced for the 1st time since buying it. Edwin recommended that I get new tires, which it did need. Picked up the car from the dealer when they were done around 2:20 PM, as I’m driving my 2 year old son to the park at 4:30 PM I get a notification that there is a fire malfunction on the front left tire. It went from 36 PSI to 1 PSI in 2 minutes, immediately pulled over since I didn’t want to risk my son’s or my safety on driving on a flat tire. When I got out, I heard the air gushing out of the tire. Called Edwin immediately, who didn’t pick up. Called the dealership right after who transferred me to Edwin who apparently was now available after I told the clerk what happened. He claimed that I obviously drove over a nail which clearly caused this, not the fact that they messed up when installing my tires. I told him that it was impossible for a nail to do that in a span of 2 minutes plus that I heard the air gushing out the tire. He didn’t care and told me to just have a tow truck take it to the dealer. Called Edwin again at 4:50 PM to try to let him know the tow truck was on its way to drop it off, didn’t pick up again. Inspected the tire for any nails, didn’t see any. When the tow truck guy arrived he also inspected the tire and didn’t find any nails. Next day they called me saying that it was a nail that immediately gave me a flat tire, not a bolt or a metal piece but a simple nail flattened my “good” Continental tires that cost almost $1,300. Requested to have the tires replaced since I no longer felt comfortable with them, said that he would have to refer me to his manager Jim. I asked Jim for a photo proving that it was a nail that did it, apparently couldn’t prove any proof that it was a nail. I told Jim that I did not feel safe with those tires, especially since my wife uses it to drive our son and requested a refund for them and buy a different brand. He stated that since driving over a nail was a common issue, he could not refund our tires or do anything for us and that what happened wasn’t a big deal even though it put my baby’s safety in jeopardy. Apparently his commission bonus is more important that a baby’s life. Jim said it was common for the “regular joe” to not see the nail since it might have been in the tread or it was “dark” when we reached. This happened at 4:30PM afternoon and 2 different people checked. I reached out to multiple mechanics and car experts who all said that it’s impossible for a nail to do that in 2 minutes, especially since I heard the air coming out and that it wasn’t installed properly. They refused to take responsibility and stuck to their lie all to keep their commission.

Reply to owner: I did, his name is Jim. He said he wasn’t able to do anything since it wasn’t a big deal and that his tire employees are highly experienced and there was no way that they messed up installing the tires. However if we were on the highway or somewhere where I couldn’t pull over, I would have been responsible for the expenses since I drove the car on a flat tire and damaged it or lost control and got into an accident.<//text>

<rating>1< /rating>< Text>
The process of buying someone's first car is always a special occasion. It should be exciting and invigorate a great feeling to the buyer. I had been looking forward to trying the Mercedes Benz for a long time based on all the things I already knew about it. So it really depends on the experience you have with salesperson to be able to get you even more excited when leaving the dealership than when you entered it. My experience with a salesperson <who shall remain nameless>  completely put me off from purchasing a new Mercedes.

I had made an appointment with them to test drive a car and even then, when I reached the dealership, it took me 45 minutes to even see the person. When we finally got to the test drive, this person was lethargic and uninterested, almost to the point where I was thinking that I wasn't being considered as a serious buyer. They didn't know half the features of the car and I had to ask them about many features which I had read up on, some of which they were not able to demonstrate. At this point I was just waiting to get out of the car. I had also asked them to follow up with an email regarding quotes and the features of the car which they had not mentioned and I received nothing. All of this just screams unprofessional to me. I entered the dealership with Mercedes as primary target and left with all impressions of the car completely tarnished.

Thankfully, I ended up purchasing a different car, and no it is not a Mercedes Benz.

TL;DR: Your car buying process heavily depends on your experience with the salesperson<//Text>

< Text>
Service was awesome!  Jake and every person I dealt with at Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek were worth 10 stars!  I would recommend them to anyone for service without hesitation!!

However, my next comment pertains specifically to MBUSA and has *nothing* to do with anyone or anything pertaining to Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek.

I currently drive a SL63, my last Mercedes was an E63.  I have extensive experience with other high end, luxury and exotic car manufacturers.  This was my first experience with any real warranty work from MBUSA.  Where other manufacturers that I have experience with tend to go out of their way to try to get everything they can covered under the bumper to bumper warranty as a way to build good will with the customer, it was my experience that MBUSA's policy is sadly just the opposite.  I will admit MBUSA's policy is perhaps more beneficial to the corporate balance sheet short term, I question the long term benefits.  The diagnostic feeS in particular are just insulting knowing how much I paid for my cars.  I'd hope one day corporate Mercedes would recognize acts of good will, while perhaps short term costly, would go a long way to building a long term customer base and profits.  I actually felt sorry for the great people at Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek for having to enforce the corporate warranty policy.< /Text>

I called and they directed my call to the service department only to be sent directly to voice mail. I left a message.  I waited almost an hour and called again AND again I was sent to voice mail. It was now 2:00pm and I was stranded and tired. I called again and was put in cue - I was 4th in line. I waited almost 1/2 hour to speak to a live person AND my battery was on low mode.
