<Rating>5< /Rating><Review>Five star experience all the way! I recently moved to the Bay Area for a new job and needed a small car to commute during the week. I did my research and narrowed it down to three small SUV type cars which included the MB GLA 250. It was the most expensive car in my lineup and thus I did not really believe it would be the one I would get.
I first went to the Nissan dealership but was disappointed that the advertised offer did not match the reality - in both the car they showed me and the cost. As it was late in the evening I planned on continuing my search the next day but on my way home passed the MB of Stevens Creek dealership and stopped to basically cross it off the list.
The car sales person that approached me was very professional and no pressure at all. I told him the car I wanted, my budget, and what I was looking for in monthly payments. After talking to his management team he came back with an offer that was within my parameters (largely due to the unexpected discount I received through my employer)  which was great and best of all there were no “hidden fees” - everything was disclosed and transparent. After agreeing and signing the contract I had the discussion with the finance person who was to my surprise a very pleasant experience - partly due to the fact that it was done super fast. I was able to drive off the lot within less then 2 hours of greeting the sales person which was a new record for me. Since I had a rental car that I needed to return to the San Jose airport I got a free ride from them and they waited and returned me back to my new car at MB Stevens Creek. Based on my experience I can only recommend this car dealership.< /Review>< Pics>

<Text>Service was awesome!  Jake and every person I dealt with at Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek were worth 10 stars!  I would recommend them to anyone for service without hesitation!!

However, my next comment pertains specifically to MBUSA and has *nothing* to do with anyone or anything pertaining to Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek.

I currently drive a SL63, my last Mercedes was an E63.  I have extensive experience with other high end, luxury and exotic car manufacturers.  This was my first experience with any real warranty work from MBUSA.  Where other manufacturers that I have experience with tend to go out of their way to try to get everything they can covered under the bumper to bumper warranty as a way to build good will with the customer, it was my experience that MBUSA's policy is sadly just the opposite.  I will admit MBUSA's policy is perhaps more beneficial to the corporate balance sheet short term, I question the long term benefits.  The diagnostic feeS in particular are just insulting knowing how much I paid for my cars.  I'd hope one day corporate Mercedes would recognize acts of good will, while perhaps short term costly, would go a long way to building a long term customer base and profits.  I actually felt sorry for the great people at Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek for having to enforce the corporate warranty policy.< /Text><pics>None< /pics>< Resp>

I booked a service for 10:10am at MB of Stevens Creek for my airbag recall.  It was very good when I got there a few minutes earlier, a gentleman greeted me and took me to the reception counter.  He also asked my name and told me my regular service guy was absent that day but they will find me another person.  I then checked the car in, and waited in the waiting area hoping my service person will show up and tell me the estimated time so I can plan for the rest of the day. I waited and waited, nobody showed up.  It’s now 11:30am so I went to the reception and asked what’s going on.  It turned out the newly assigned service person was absent that morning.  I was given a name card and told I should call that person if I don’t receive a call by 2:00pm.  So I took a shuttle to my friend’s home.  I called around 2:20pm as I didn’t receive a call.  I got a voicemail.  At 3:30 I finally received a call from my service person. He told me the car won’t be ready that day but next morning.  I wasn’t offered any loaner car.  I was thinking how I can get home that day and I need a car for next day so I called back.  Voicemail again.  I called the office wishing to ask if a loaner car is available but I was transferred to him and he didn’t pick up.  I had to go back to the dealer and talk to someone that I need a loaner. This is the worst service I received from MB of Stevens Creek. My husband also complained about its service.  I am seriously thinking to get a Japanese car next time as their dealer’s service is much better.  The management, please think how to improve your processes, keep your customer informed and happy!< /Text>

I have to say I am highly impressed with my overall experience. This is the 1st time I have owned a Mercedes and utilized service @ Stevens Creek Mercedes. < Text>
This review describes the service drop-off appointment only - will update as the engagement progresses.

Condescending service rep.
I prepared a list of items I needed help with - his first response without reviewing the list was that it would cost over $2000 for them to look at the issues. He was reminding me obsessively of how much each item would cost to diagnose as we were going through the list as if alluding to my not being well off enough to be able to pay for it. Pricing is not in question - they decide what to charge (even though why would one charge for a full hour in case diagnostics take 3 minutes to complete?) It was the attitude of the service rep that was unacceptable - he was not particularly respectful overall, somewhat abrupt, and clearly wanted to get rid of me as soon as possible. When I said I might not have an insurance card with me (which I ended up finding shortly thereafter), he immediately said, "you cannot get a loaner then". A truly helpful attitude. Not. Not an smile, not a how are you, not a thank you - nothing.

A "why am I here?" lady at the loaner car station.
She looked as if she was really unhappy about being there and having to work with all these annoying customers who wanted something from her. Uninterested and unwelcoming. Put more gas on the loaner form than the loaner actually had in it. Did grace me with a smile on my way out, though.

All in all - way far from an experience I expected from a Mercedes dealership or any customer-friendly place. I needed to stop by a CVS after dropping off the car and, ironically, the polite and welcoming treatment from a CVS cashier was in stark contrast to the experience I had at Mercedes Stevens Creek.</Text>

The Stevens Creek location is nice and clean. The worked performed on my car was complete and correct. But there is something important that this dealership is missing and that is their customer service. Owning a Mercedes should be a great experience. This is a world-class car. < Text>
Five star experience all the way! I recently moved to the Bay Area for a new job and needed a small car to commute during the week. I did my research and narrowed it down to three small SUV type cars which included the MB GLA 250. It was the most expensive car in my lineup and thus I did not really believe it would be the one I would get.
I first went to the Nissan dealership but was disappointed that the advertised offer did not match the reality - in both the car they showed me and the cost. As it was late in the evening I planned on continuing my search the next day but on my way home passed the MB of Stevens Creek dealership and stopped to basically cross it off the list.
The car sales person that approached me was very professional and no pressure at all. I told him the car I wanted, my budget, and what I was looking for in monthly payments. After talking to his management team he came back with an offer that was within my parameters (largely due to the unexpected discount I received through my employer)  which was great and best of all there were no “hidden fees” - everything was disclosed and transparent. After agreeing and signing the contract I had the discussion with the finance person who was to my surprise a very pleasant experience - partly due to the fact that it was done super fast. I was able to drive off the lot within less then 2 hours of greeting the sales person which was a new record for me. Since I had a rental car that I needed to return to the San Jose airport I got a free ride from them and they waited and returned me back to my new car at MB Stevens Creek. Based on my experience I can only recommend this car dealership.<//Text>

1593446297577< /Date>
<Rate>1<//Rate>< text>
The temporary registration I was given is incomplete and a bill of sale was not provided. I went back and all you would give me is a copy of the application to transfer title. Because of this I can’t use this car for work until the DMV send me a legitimate registration with the existing plate numbers. On top of this the car broke down after 4 days and I had to have it towed back to Mercedes, they said they would look at it but now I will be outside of the 5 day return policy, I am very upset with Mercedes of Stevens creek and I am not vining my Mercedes here for service and will tell anyone I know to avoid this place.

Update:
I just spoke with Kevin the GM and he was quite helpful and reassuring. Said that he will look into the mechanical issue with the car to see what can be done to fix it and will extend the 5 day return period.  I hope it all works out.

2nd Update:
Got a call Saturday that my car was ready for pickup. Was told it was an aftermarket alarm system that they removed and car was working fine. I drove it home, reset the auto door locks to all open when the key remote unlock is pressed, then the car wouldn’t start anymore!

Returned the car and was told I would be getting a check in one week, great they took it back but I really don’t understand why I need to wait one week to get paid. When I bought it I paid in full before I drove it off the lot, I didn’t tell them I’d stop back in a week and give them a check. I wish I never went to Stevens Creek Mercedes in the first place.

3rd Update:
Went back on 1/27 Monday to get my check they said they could only pay me for my trade-in. Had me sign several blank DMV forms, wait 2hrs still wouldn’t give me any of my money for the trade-in or the purchase price of the returned car.
Shawn the head of finance said they would print the checks Tuesday and next day them to me for Wednesday.....
Wednesday 1/29 still no check.
Not sure what to do, this dealership seems very dishonest they can’t tell me when they will return my money and are continuing to string me along.
I think I will go to the DMV tomorrow and see if they can help me recover my two cars that they seem to have taken and refused to pay for.

4th Update:
Friday 1/31, no check in the mail yet so I drove back to Stevens Creek Mercedes. Great news! they had the check for the car I returned (dated 1/28, not sure why they never mailed it).
I still need to wait for the check for my trade-in.

(5th Update)

6/29/2020
They still have not payed me for my trade in. Over 6 months since returning the purchased car and asking for their 5 day 250 mile return refund. Again after several weeks they did return the cash I paid but still have NOT paid for the trade-in car I sold them!< /text>

We purchased a car At Mercedes of Steven's Creek recently. This car has many incredible safety and navigation features, including Android Auto Capability, but there is a learning curve on these things. The dealership has a Concierge who walks you through how to use your complex new car. Christian was excellent, and we can go back as many times as we need to. He is the "genius bar" for Mercedes. <rating>1<//rating><review>This review describes the service drop-off appointment only - will update as the engagement progresses.

Condescending service rep.
I prepared a list of items I needed help with - his first response without reviewing the list was that it would cost over $2000 for them to look at the issues. He was reminding me obsessively of how much each item would cost to diagnose as we were going through the list as if alluding to my not being well off enough to be able to pay for it. Pricing is not in question - they decide what to charge (even though why would one charge for a full hour in case diagnostics take 3 minutes to complete?) It was the attitude of the service rep that was unacceptable - he was not particularly respectful overall, somewhat abrupt, and clearly wanted to get rid of me as soon as possible. When I said I might not have an insurance card with me (which I ended up finding shortly thereafter), he immediately said, "you cannot get a loaner then". A truly helpful attitude. Not. Not an smile, not a how are you, not a thank you - nothing.

A "why am I here?" lady at the loaner car station.
She looked as if she was really unhappy about being there and having to work with all these annoying customers who wanted something from her. Uninterested and unwelcoming. Put more gas on the loaner form than the loaner actually had in it. Did grace me with a smile on my way out, though.

All in all - way far from an experience I expected from a Mercedes dealership or any customer-friendly place. <time>1551333593483<//time>< Text>
3.0 star rating 2/27/2019   Updated review
So a year later I scheduled the B service maintenance and was told they would need the car for 4 to 6 hrs. I therefore scheduled a loaner car again. When I got to the service intake area I sat in a line and watched as cars in front of me were greeted by service writers. I started to notice that the service writers were attending to the cars behind me as well. "Be patient"  I said to myself, they are very busy. After another 20 min I was the only one sitting in a car. Hmmm. I went inside to inquire at the service desk and was asked who my service rep was. When I mentioned Joseph's name I was informed that he no longer works for Stevens Creek Mercedes. ???? So this was supposed to explain why no one approached my vehicle??? They eventually got someone to check me in. "Nate", told me that there were no more loaner vehicles available. I mentioned that I had confirmed the loaner the day before and he apologized explaining that they only have so many loaners and if customers do not return them when expected they run out. I live in Santa Cruz and had an important medical treatment in the early afternoon. I asked what options were available but was met with a blank stare. He did offer to reschedule but I did not want to go through that commute hassle again, rain, accidents and all. To his credit Nate did offer to fast track the maintenance and indicated that he might be able to have it before noon. The car was ready at 11:30 and that worked for me. So three stars for courtesy and fast service, minus one star for stiffing me on the loaner, minus another star for leaving me sitting with no service rep assigned. In future I will be looking for other options when I need service.</Text>

<text>STAY AWAY!!!! My entire experience with Mercedes-Benz of Steven's Creek has been a nightmare!  These people sell defective cars and do not care about people's safety!! I wish I could give less than a star!

I purchased a second-hand Subaru from the dealership that included a 90 day warranty, and 5 day return policy. The car was sold to me as in perfect condition, with a clean CARFAX report.

On the drive home, I noticed the right mirror shaking dangerously - the whole plastic casing was broken. I brought the car back immediately and requested a return as I didn't want other undisclosed problems down the line. They convinced me to keep it and assured me they would repair it and do a full inspection. My new car was in service the whole first week I had it. Said inspection came out showing everything in perfect condition.

A month later, I went for an oil change at Subaru and asked for a multi-point inspection because the car didn't feel right and had been making lots of strange sounds. The report showed that the front axel needed immediate attention. I had had the car for just a month at this point, and was still covered by the warranty. I checked, and axel parts are covered in their limited warranty.

I tried contacting Mercedes-Benz of Steven's Creek every day and only got unreturned voicemails. I had to drive twice from Santa Cruz to San Jose just to be able to talk to someone, and kept being bounced around between sales and servicing. I was told that this was actually a pre-existing condition they had been aware of, but had concealed to me. Only the threat of legal action got them to actually listen and eventually take my car into service.

When I got my car back, it sounded and felt even worse than before! I drove halfway down the street and immediately turned back. I asked the technicians to test drive it down the street with me or just simply just listen to the car and they told me to come back as they were closing.

I went straight back to Subaru for a full inspection and they told me the axel had been replaced with an even worse condition after market one that was leaking grease, that the rotors were now out of round, problems with the wheel bearings, and shake and vibration at all speeds including when the vehicle is stopped. Instead of repairing it, Mercedes-Benz Steven's Creek only further damaged my car, causing $2000 worth of damages, while still under their warranty.

The steering wheel and paddles shake when braking and it feels like the axel might break at any moment cause a big accident, and feels very unsafe to drive. I haven't really been able to use my car since they "repaired" it.

I have all the paperwork and proof showing their wrongdoings and will be taking this to court. You'd think that a business using the name of Mercedes-Benz would uphold some sort of standard, but the service here is appalling - avoid this business at all cost if you value your safety!!!!</text>< GmapID>

First impression. My prior to purchase experience with the internet sales manager who’s name is Val Estrada was nice. Since I’m not from the Bay Area, Val sent me some additional pictures of the car and answered to all my emails in a timely manner. Once we came to test drive the car she was knowledgeable and not pushy.

Second thoughts. Once Val transferred me and my husband to the finance manager Peter Nguen all the hell began. First off, he messed the financing period and instead of requested 48 months financing, he specified 60 months. Secondly, he was very pushy. This is not our first experience buying a car from Autonation and we’re more than happy with their network. And obviously we know all their maintenance  and additional coverage options, that we didn’t want to purchase for this particular car. It was 6PM and we told him that we need to drive 4 hours back home, that we know everything about Autonation plans and we don’t want any of those options and we want to close the deal ASAP. He continued calculated something and showing us the potential advantages for freaking 2 hours. Once we insisted that we didn’t want anything he changed his face, became very upset and angry. < review>
The store experience was really good. No issues there. But have an issue with Mercedes in general. I leased my car like 10 months back, there's hardly 6K miles on the car. But suddenly the air started to leak from one of the tires. Later found out that there was no puncture but a small crack in the rim. So i had to replace the RIM which costed me around 1.2K$'s. I have never seen this kind of issue in the past. Me and my parents owned a honda for more than 15 years now and it has more than 150K miles. We never saw any issue with the tire rim. The only reason I am posting this is because the dealer told me that rims usually crack or break if you go through a pot hole or something. No sir they don't i have not seen such kind of issue in the past that too on a brand new car within a year. The quality of the mercedes parts has depreceated a lot it seems then... nothing else.</review>

Finally, I called MB financial and they with the help of my local DMV Angel were able to send proof of ownership to the Texas DMV so I could register and DRIVE my new car.

I’m appalled that a Mercedes dealership, or any other business would flat out ignore a customer. <Rate>4<//Rate>< text>
It is actually ONE Star for my most recent service.  To be fair, I have received 30+ Years of FIVE star service at ‘Smythe’ on Stevens Creek.  But this most recent experience compelled me to knock it down to FOUR stars.

My experience for what should have been an uneventful annual service was a tragic comedy of errors.

I dropped my car off for its annual inspection service last Wednesday and it was completed at the end of the day, Thursday.  They said just over on Friday for pick up, which I did.  My hubby dropped me off at 10am and left, and I went to pay the cashier and then waited for my car to be brought up.  I waited, and waited... and patiently waited.     I never knew I’d be waiting for so long and did not take note of the exact elapsed time.  I’d say that I waited half hour or more and no-once told me how much longer it will take.  And, mind you, this is for pick-up only!

The story is that this facility/dealership is servicing 100-150 cars per day and there are so many cars going in and out, that they are tight with parking. When they park a car, they turn the hazard lights on so that they have less chance of an accident.  Unfortunately, after they parked my car on Thursday, at the completion of the service, they did not turn off the hazard light.

So, when I went there on Friday for pick up, THEY CANNOT FIND MY CAR.  They use my key to find the exact parking location, but with the dead battery, they were unable to locate my vehicle.

They had to give me a rental car so that I can wait at home for the battery to re-charge , and return 4 hours later.<//text>

< review>
I visited on Memorial weekend. A passing sales guy told me they were very busy and that it would be better to make an appointment and come back later, like during the week. I couldn't believe my ears. They were telling a potential customer to piss off.

In the end, it took 40 minutes to get service. The first salesguy I had to walk up to because he was just standing around, picking his nose. I passed by two more like this. (Sorry guys, not a way to do business...when you see me wandering around casually, looking at your cars...GET A CLUE, WALK UP TO ME, AND ASK IF I NEED HELP.)

We talked for a few minutes and he said he needed to run back inside to get me an updated price list. After waiting for him to return for 10 minutes, I realized he had ditched me.

Livid, I walked back into the dealership and asked for someone else, after the receptionist asked if I was being helped. I spoke to her when I first arrived. She said they were quite busy and offered to put my name down on the waiting list to talk to someone, but that it would take 40 minutes. That's when I started wandering around and seeing sales guys standing around picking their noses.

I eventually asked for a particular salesman on the recommendation of a friend. He really took the time to sit down, explain to me the different models, and took me on several test drives. While I finally got the help I needed, this should have never happened.

If you're busy, it's your fault. You have historical data and should have staffed up. I don't know if I'll buy a car from them after the way I was treated. While there was one good seed, I have to wonder about the rest of the staff.

Update (6/13/2018)
I'm beginning to think the response from Mercedes is a formality and that they have no intentions on following through and providing the good service they promised.

I called and left a message with the General Manager on Monday afternoon. Never heard back. Tried again in Wednesday, just to be told the manager is in meetings all day long and I should leave a message in his voicemail.

What for?  So you guys can continue to ignore me, just as you did when I first walked into your dealership? You guys just don't get it...< /review>

Their process if you buy the car even if you live in a different state, you have to pay California taxes or you have to get it shipped, even though the law clearly states that you can show a tax or utility bill that you live somewhere else so you don't have to pay taxes. therefore I decided to get the car ship based on their process as it was cheaper than paying taxes.

For the time I agreed to purchase the car, it took three weeks just to get the paperwork to me, during that time I had to keep following up to understand what the issue was and nobody seems to know and I keep get an answer "you should have it tomorrow". I've been a customer of the MB of Stevens Creek for over 6 years now and I must say that this was probably the worst experience I've had so far. Still giving it two stars because the staff is very friendly and pleasure to deal with. Shuttle service is timely and high quality.  My complain though is about the complimentary car wash I received along with the courtesy appointment after 3 months from buying the car (a very nice touch!). When my car was delivered it had wet spots on passenger seat that valet had to wipe off before giving me the key. That would have been okay but once I left the dealership I noticed that my wood and leather steering wheel is covered with something resembling either dried dirt or soap. I had to pull over and try to clean the wheel with drinking water (I had no time to come back to the dealer). Then I noticed oily/soapy fingerprints on central console buttons. Also, the quality of the actual wash was not good - there were dirt droplet marks on the rear bumper and next to rear view mirrors. The car looked more like it came out of rain rather than from a car wash.
I really like this dealer and my experience had been perfect all these years. It is a pity that a thing as simple as a car wash can make it this unpleasant. I am sure that this was a one off (probably a car wash guy was really ready for the Friday and didn't care about cars much). I just want to make them aware of my experience to fix it for other customers and myself in the future.< /text>

< Text>
The store experience was really good. No issues there. But have an issue with Mercedes in general. I leased my car like 10 months back, there's hardly 6K miles on the car. But suddenly the air started to leak from one of the tires. Later found out that there was no puncture but a small crack in the rim. So i had to replace the RIM which costed me around 1.2K$'s. I have never seen this kind of issue in the past. Me and my parents owned a honda for more than 15 years now and it has more than 150K miles. We never saw any issue with the tire rim. The only reason I am posting this is because the dealer told me that rims usually crack or break if you go through a pot hole or something. No sir they don't i have not seen such kind of issue in the past that too on a brand new car within a year. The quality of the mercedes parts has depreceated a lot it seems then... nothing else.</Text>

After 20 minutes i decided to try again and was deliberately avoided by edwin as he sat and stared at his phone when i asked him for help again. He said "i didnt look like i needed help" after this i left completely enraged and feeling profiled because of the color of my skin and went to beschoff mercedes on capitol. Im a proffesional athlete with many friends that are going to want the car I just bought, i will be directing them to Beschoff. You should teach Edwin to treat everyone with the same respect. his pockets and the companys pockets could have been a little fatter after dealing with my team and I. I really hope someone addresses this i should have gotten it on camera and went to the news.<//Review>

<review>I did my 70K-mile car service in Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek, which included a transmission service in Dec 2018. I started to notice some minor transmission issue 2 month later, but I was too busy around that time and had a long vacation abroad afterwards, so I didn't get a chance to send my car for a diagnosis and repairment at that moment. After my vacation, while the first day I was driving, the car was broken on the freeway. Since I am an AAA member, so I asked AAA to tow my car to their car service center. They checked my car, and noticed there were couple missing codes shown in car's system. Under my permission, AAA teardowned my transmission, and detected the fluid in the transmission was low and couple parts including the gears were burnt. I spent couple thousands dollars for the repairment and the rentals. After the repairment, I brought AAA's report back to Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek. Over one week back and forth calls,  I finally met their manager. He asked me for the evidences, including: how much was the fluid in the transmission when broken? what was the methods the AAA's engineer measured it, and was that following the Mercedes engineer's working flow? and asked to bring the broken parts to him. Unfortunately, I don't have any, since AAA's engineer was using different way for checking and repairment as Mercedes' engineer does. I believe the broken car itself was the best evidence. I mentioned that they could reopen my transmission for investigation. They said I would have to pay the money for the checking, and the results might not help with anything neither, since it was repaired and no evidence anymore. I called Mercedes manufactory for help, and got feedbacks that this kind of issues they can not help, have to talk with the dealership level, which means the manager again. I already spent much time for the initial car service, car broken, car checking,  repairment, bringing back to Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek, talking with the Mercedes' specialists,and then the manager, asking AAA's help with the "evidences", and more, and finally got nothing. So I might leave it up, don't want to waste more time on it. The best answer would be: I would never purchase this brand any more to avoid this troubles. I write my story up, just for the people who might have similar issues as me, please keep your EVIDENCES, and don't get your car repaired yet. Hope my experience could help with someone. I personally would never forever purchase this brand of car any more. And be careful when sending your car to have the services in this place. I personally sent my car here for service for at least 6 times, and spent couple thousands dollars here; the first 5 times were good, but as long as once it was not done properly, I had to spend much more money and time, but without anything solved. < text>
My experience has been that service at Stevens Creek Mercedes is getting worse. Maybe it’s because my car is only a 2012 c250 coupe and over the 60k mileage? Every time I take it in some expensive repair work is suggested. Most of the suggested repair work is after the warranty period expires. In the 70k service, engine mounts were found “collapsed” (estimate to fix $1500). On getting a second opinion outside, it was not cited as an issue. I have been exclusively servicing at Stevens Creek Mercedes. This car has had too many reliability issues starting well before the warranty period expired. Luckily it was covered under warranty upto 50k miles.
At 70k, they informed me I needed to replace front and rear brakes, including drums (cost $1500 in addition to the $1000 servicing), even though rear brakes were recently replaced. At 80k, the ‘front sway bar links’ were also suggested as needing replacement, and in addition, rear tires. All tires were replaced at Mercedes at 70k miles. Previous tires lasted me at least 20k miles. Right from being bought from Mercedes, the right front tire kept losing air pressure gradually especially in cold temperatures, and they claim there is no issue.
I also was unable to get a loaner during service (need to make an appointment 20 days in advance) and it took me over an hour during my work hours to get the shuttle, then took me again more than an hour to get home. They do not pick you up either. For a car that cost me @50k, I expected better reliability and maintenance costs.<//text>

< Review>
I was in car search all by myself for almost 2 months and boy it was  stressful. Reached Stevens Creek Mercedes a day before labour day and David handled my request. He understood where I stand at and all my concerns. Even the manager came to the picture during the end of this process. As any car dealership, there were some serious negotiations. We came to a common ground and finished the deal. Over all, I made 2 store visits and 4 phone calls. When the deal was finalized, I felt both parties won. As dealers they gained some profit from me. From my end, they treated me with respect (which is a big deal because I visited other brands dealerships too), and I am happy with the car [GLA 250 4Matic] which came around my budget.

Since it is a big dealership I felt intimidated in the beginning. My suggestion to first time car buyers, Don't feel intimidated. This dealership represents a brand. Stick to your budget, be reasonable in your quote and remember you are the buyer.

PS> I am currently happy and recommend this showroom. I hope nothing unexpected comes up and goes side ways in the future though!<//Review>

<Rate>1<//Rate><text>Great Price, Horrific Customer Service
MBSC Salesman: Kevin Hua
MBSC Sales Manager: Safi Hatoum
MBSC Finance Manager: Aaron Riddle

The E400 would be my 12th Mercedes, second car purchased from MBSC. Out of all my years and all the Mercedes I’ve purchased this is by far the WORST customer service (communication) I’ve experienced from a Mercedes Benz dealership.

I’ve had the worst communication with all levels of MBSC from the salesman Kevin Hua, the Sales Manager Safi Hatoum and Finance Manager Aaron Riddle. To Aaron’s credit he’s given me the most information. The process was so botched that the price of the car dropped while waiting on information.  As of today 26 Apr I’m still waiting for the refund check of $400, the title to the vehicle as well as the vehicle itself. The reason I’m given Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek (MBSC) a 1-star is because my previous experience was the complete opposite of this one. The 1-star is for the price. The lack of communication was so poor I called Mercedes Benz Corporate and requested they make contact with the dealership but they were unable to reach any of the 3 folks and opened a case to help get someone’s attention.

During this experience I can’t understand why MBSC made buying a car such a horrible experience for me.

My son will be turning 16 this year which means I’ll be purchasing another Mercedes in the not so distant future. Given what I know of MBSC I’ll search their inventory find a vehicle with a great price and try my best to get another dealer to match it.

One thing I know about the Mercedes brand is The Best or Nothing. Unfortunately I can’t say the same for MBSC and it’s staff and how I’ve been treated. Communication is free, however the lack of communication will cost a whole lot more.

Timeline of E400 purchase from MBSC:
Friday 5 Apr - request a PO on an E400
Sat 6 Apr - received PO on the E400
Tues 9 Apr - MBSC received my check for the E400
Thurs 11 Apr - I received and signed the contact
Fri 12 Apr - MBSC received signed contract
Tues 16 Apr - I received an email stating the price of the car was lowered by $400
Thurs 18 Apr - Aaron R. emailed me stating he received confirmation of transport. I understood that to mean they would be picking up the vehicle from the dealership.
Thurs 25 Apr - I was contacted by the transportation company
As of today 26 Apr I still haven’t received the car, the title or the $400 check.

I pray no one else will have this experience.

Mercedes, the BEST or NOTHING!!!<//text><pictures>None<//pictures><Response>{'time': 1556575825905, 'text': "Hi Joseph, we appreciate you taking the time to respond. <Date>1505756248922< /Date><GmapID>0x808fca855c879807:0xa6eb059ea5b89798</GmapID>< Text>
I was in car search all by myself for almost 2 months and boy it was  stressful. Reached Stevens Creek Mercedes a day before labour day and David handled my request. He understood where I stand at and all my concerns. Even the manager came to the picture during the end of this process. As any car dealership, there were some serious negotiations. We came to a common ground and finished the deal. Over all, I made 2 store visits and 4 phone calls. When the deal was finalized, I felt both parties won. As dealers they gained some profit from me. From my end, they treated me with respect (which is a big deal because I visited other brands dealerships too), and I am happy with the car [GLA 250 4Matic] which came around my budget.

Since it is a big dealership I felt intimidated in the beginning. My suggestion to first time car buyers, Don't feel intimidated. This dealership represents a brand. Stick to your budget, be reasonable in your quote and remember you are the buyer.

PS> I am currently happy and recommend this showroom. I hope nothing unexpected comes up and goes side ways in the future though!< /Text>

<user>108404562452179650202< /user><name>Keith Pratt</name><Date>1506397151310</Date><Rating>3<//Rating>< Text>
My service experience was adequate but not stellar.  Jake Tran, my service advisor, was knowledgable and attentive, but certain outcomes left a bit to be desired.

Ever since I owned the car, I noticed a pulse in the tires.  After three days in service, the technicians determined that the alignment was fine and diagnosed the problem as occurring due to cupping of the front tires.  I have had the car for only a few months, and according to the manager, the tire warranty period had already passed.  They offered no explanation as to the cause of the cupping.   He offered me a 20% on new tires--yes, replacements after only 8K miles--but I declined because I knew they would charge the usual dealership-inflated prices (no pun intended).

Now I have two options:  tolerate the pulse until the tires wear out, or buy new tires.  Neither option is appealing, and neither was my service experience.< /Text>

< user_name>
John Doe<//user_name>
<text>I usually dont post reviews but the service (or rather severe lack of) needs to be known by prospective customers Look at the yelp reviews for more similar stories. Here were my highlights at Stevens creek benz:

1. Damaged rims after service. They only fixed them once I revealed I had evidence. Refused to switch them, now have refurbished rims due to their negligence. Take pictures of your car before servicing anywhere. Take a picture of your mileage. Important for #2

2. The car was driven 10 miles for a simple oil change. There is absolutely no reason a customer car should be driven more than a mile for an oil change. It was obvious it was driven for non-service related activities.

3. No uber or shuttle service. They rarely have rental cars available, but they offer no uber or shuttle service alternative. I haven't been to a single dealership (let alone a luxury brand) that does not offer a ride service for appointments that last several hours.

4. Incompetence. The one instance I got a rental car, I was given the keys and led to the rental car. The keys did not work, so I checked the license plate number on the rental form and they did not match the car I was led to. The young teenager (appeared very young) that was responsible for the rental service gave me attitude insisting it was the correct car until I had to physically point to the differences in license plate numbers. This is ridiculous for a German luxury brand dealership that demands a premium fee in exchange for professional service.  You get none of that here. Only the premium price.

Benz owners beware of this place.<//text></record></dataset><record>

<Text>We bought a new GLK 350 last week and we had an excellent experience. We had not taken an appointment for our test drive but we were promptly set up with Walter, our sales person. I have to say Walter took care of us very well and his entire approach was very refined (much like the Mercedes brand itself). He was understanding and accommodating, allowing us to take our time as we fiddled around with the instrument cluster and figured out how to use the various gadgets. In fact he took us to a lot where they keep a bunch of new models so that we had first hand experience with all the different options and colors. He even took the trouble of lining up the different cars side by side to help us make a decision. He spent about 3 hrs with us that day and we never felt rushed. He was very knowledgeable about the cars, the history of the brand and also had some nice tidbits about Smythe's own history in the valley.

We decided to buy the car 2 days later. The decision was based on the virtues of the product but the buying experience always has a big part to play for my wife and me. Completing the purchase with the finance department was just as smooth. Nick, the finance manager, had no trouble with redoing our contract thrice due to changes in how we wanted to finance the purchase.

I highly recommend based on our experience.< /Text><Pics>None<//Pics>< resp>

< Review>
"One person can make a big difference to the entire organization". I realized it here.

I have been visiting this dealership for service ever since I owned a Merc from Oct 2013. I am seeing a drastic change in the service reception area starting Feb or March this year. In the past when I used to drive, I will see lot of chaos and poor management of customers. I have myself waited a long time with no one attending. See - when you goto service, the one and only thing you need is to be attended soon and taken care properly. Things changed from Feb / Mar this year. I have visited the area 3 to 4 times for service and maintenance reasons since Feb this year.
This staff - Kristina Bowman has been adding great value to Customers since then. As we drive in, she quickly takes care of the customers and she is fast with lot of energy. She also keeps asking the customers how she can help to make sure they are fully taken care and leave the dealership with a smile. Very rare to find a staff who keeps Customer in front and everything aside.
That is Kristina for you. And with Kristina Bowman, this dealership service experience is excelled many times. Excellent job!!!

I also want to thank my service advisor Elizabeth Pierce. I have been twice put to Elizabeth and at both times she kept me educated on what is expected and what is not expected. Setting the expectations right is the key to Customer satisfaction particularly when it comes to giving your car for service. She is very good at that. Also, she follows up diligently on when the car is available and keeps me posted. There is zero ambiguity with Elizabeth and she makes me feel special all the time. Particularly this time when I dropped my car, I had a few things, very small things, but she took notes on everything and made sure everything is taken care of. When I picked up my car, on that particular day, she was not there - but still whatever I told has been completely taken care. This is called Customer Delight. I happily drove my car back and happy to have serviced in this dealership.

With one person out in the drive in "Kristina Bowman", with one person inside "Elizabeth Pierce" - this dealership makes a big difference now. Keep up the excellent work and thanks for taking care of Customers.< /Review>

My wife and I were assisted by Mark Arnold at Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek when we decided to purchase a new GLC. We scheduled a test drive with Mark and after we decided to go for the vehicle, Mark guided us with the optional features/packages and locate a vehicle that was in the Bay Area and available within a couple of days. We really loved our interaction with Mark who was super nice through out the process and never pushed us with anything. So I highly recommend going to MB of Stevens Creek and going with Mark! One nit with the overall process - there was a fair amount of paperwork involving writing and signing with pen on paper. A (green) improvement could be to make all of that online and use Docusign.<//text>

< rate>
1<//rate>
<review>I own two C-class cars and had them serviced by this dealership during warranty. One was OK, not great. They eventually solved all issues although at times it would take several tries and return visits. On another they never were able to fix climate control which seems to be responding to the outside temp rather than to the inside, never solved GPG problem which occasionally misplaces my car. The worst was high latitude stalling. When going to Tahoe or LA over I5 the car stalled climbing to about 4000 feet. Then it would "rest" for about 30 minutes and not have the same problem until another trip up. These guys charged me for full diagnostic and could not find a problem. They suggested to "try using another car key" because the car "is finicky"...  They then bombarded me with emails insisting on giving them highest service rating in a survey sent by MB. I did not but MB did not seem to care. All these surveys are a marketing show.

An independent mechanic instantly diagnosed the problem as a sticking air intake sensor and fixed it for less that cost of diagnostics at the dealership. The car started responding better and does not stall in the mountains anymore.

If an authorized MB dealer cannot fix that simple of a problem I am not buying MB again. I work in Germany and my company cars are BMWs. Not one problem in 7 years!

P.S. I just noticed that the dealership posted a response to the review on Google asking me to talk to their GM.  If they really wanted to talk to me they could easily call me - my phone is in their files.<//review><pics>None<//pics>< resp>

< Review>
I would like to take this opportunity to say that I had a fantastic experience for repair services of my 2020 GLE at the Mercedes-Benz of Steve Creek and the excellent support received from my service advisor Susan Sulimani.

My car needed multiple repairs and seemed to have complicated battery/software issues, however Susan explained the technical issues in a super clear and upfront way and kept me constantly posted throughout the repair process. After repairs she also made sure to reach out and check on the car condition and my satisfactions with the whole experience, which was fantastic.

Susan totally earns my business and I am very pleased for knowing her and I would certainly recommend her as the service advisor to work with at Mercedes-Benz of Steven Creeks.

Other staffs were also super professional and helpful in every step of the way.

<Name>Hector Caban</Name><date>1526413825782< /date><rate>2< /rate>< text>
I made this appointment on 4/26/18 because the other 2 Mercedes dealerships in South San Jose and in Monterey do not work on Mercedes RV, and we live 45 miles away from the Stevens Creek dealership, in Watsonvile, California.
While I was taken in right away by Felix Alvarez , he rushed me through and had me set up right away but I was never asked if I wanted a hard copy of my estimate but sent a e-mail instead. I looked for the e-mail but it had not arrived when I received a call from my wife, we are both Seniors, and on fixed incomes. She was questioning why we are paying so much and wanted a breakdown of the charges, since I did not have the e-mail invoice of the charges I went to Felix desk and looked at my invoice while explaining to my wife and meantime Felix arrives after a few seconds and says in his normal tone of voice “YOU IN TROUBLE NOW” and asked me if I wanted to take the invoice to the customer waiting area. My wife hears this and goes ballistic over the phone, I told Felix don’t say anything she can hear you. I then returned to my chair. When I finally saw the e-mail of the estimate it stated that I had not requested shard copy of the estimated costs with a check mark on the location where it asked.

After 15 minutes Felix was walking by and I told Felix I wanted to bring my business to this dealership because of the excellent reputation I had heard from friends who own Mercedes cars, and it is bad enough my wife and her mechanic son did not want me to bring it here because of the expensive bill, Felix told me he had a customer and went outside.

Upon his return I approached his desk the for future reference/advice not to make any comments while a customer is talking on his personal cell phone it is BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE , Felix told me that I was at his work station and I should not be looking at other service orders, I told him I was looking at my own service order and that the service orders should not be left out in the open desk area where it is open on two sides and went back to my chair. This happened at 10:40am and I expected an apology but none came during this time period I overheard comments from an advisor named Susan of This is a nice customer while she introduced another customer to Felix and what’s up with these customers. Well has a former customer service representative for the Postal Service and retired union officer I expected better customer service. <user_name>Ron Emilio< /user_name><gmap_id>0x808fca855c879807:0xa6eb059ea5b89798< /gmap_id><text>Because I ordered a 2018 SL550 in July of 2017, there was a bit of a wait. Storms at sea also contributed to a bit of a delay. Despite these factors, I received my SL550 in November exactly as I had ordered it. I absolutely love the car.

My sales rep, Dusan, was there the entire time to guide me and to answer all my questions. He made the process of buying my car so simple. I'd use him again should I buy another Mercedes. Everyone from the receptionist, to the parts department, to the finance people, to the technicians who helped me learn how to operate the car were accessible and friendly and extremely helpful.

Thanks to you all.

R.E.

02/01/19
On 01/28/19 I brought my SL550 in for it's first service(only 2242 miles but tired of seeing the reminder on dash). It should have taken only a part of one day to complete the job. I got a call from my service advisor that during the wiper replacement, the tech cracked the windshield. I was told that the glass had to come from the East coast so it would take 5 to 7 business days to arrive. That is where I am at this time...waiting. I DO have a loaner, however.

<rating>5</rating>< Text>
I would like to take this opportunity to say that I had a fantastic experience for repair services of my 2020 GLE at the Mercedes-Benz of Steve Creek and the excellent support received from my service advisor Susan Sulimani.

My car needed multiple repairs and seemed to have complicated battery/software issues, however Susan explained the technical issues in a super clear and upfront way and kept me constantly posted throughout the repair process. She is highly courteous, knowledgable, and precise in every conversation and does not miss any details from the moment I dropped off my car until I picked up the car. After repairs she also made sure to reach out and check on the car condition and my satisfactions with the whole experience, which was fantastic.

Susan totally earns my business and I am very pleased for knowing her and I would certainly recommend her as the service advisor to work with at Mercedes-Benz of Steven Creeks.

Other staffs were also super professional and helpful in every step of the way.

< Review>
From my experience this actually seems like a really good shop and i'm a big skeptic when it comes to auto sales esp. for luxury brands. They offered me a very reasonable price, the sales person was knowledgeable and not pushy and just a nice guy. They went an extra mile to follow up on the purchase even after the deal was closed. I think the reason is they are a really high volume shop so they don't have to mark up their cars much and they actually value their customers and reputation more than quick profit. There are some shops that seem to have cash'n'run mentality but this isn't one of them and it's refreshing. (My sales person was Shawn). As a bonus they do have some gorgeous cars on the floor so there's always something to gawk at while in the lobby :)< /Review>

< Review>
Recently, I joined the Mercedes-Benz family. I was incredibly impressed with the service I received from every person at the dealership. My salesman, Vo, was kind, patient, and grateful. He was eager to please, but not pushy - perfect fit for the type of customer that I am. My next interaction was with the GSM, Stan. He was professional, a straight-shooter and there were no games involved. Lastly, I sat down with Joseph in Finance. Joseph was very personable and knowledgable. He listened to my needs and "not necessaries" and was able to suggest packages accordingly. On my way out, I received handshakes from all involved with my purchase. This was a seamless afternoon. I highly recommend Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek. Thanks, guys!

<rate>5< /rate>< Review>
I went to the place at 3/24 at firstly, and looking for a C300, not decided to buy a new car or a CPO car or lease a one at that time. Jerald (hope I remember the correct name) talked to me first, then it is Jorainna who handle all my subsequent purchase process.  It is easy for me to discuss with Jorainna in Chinese. Anyway, both of them are really nice.
Finally I decided to lease a white 2018 C300, but on that day  the quote is not attracting (approximately ~20K for 36months in total), so I held off and Jorainna  suggest me ask quote at the end of each Quarter, when they might have a better deal.
On 3/31, the last day of Quarter 1, and that is a Saturday, Jorainna called me saying there is new quote, and when I see the message, It is really a good discount (1500 downpayment with 36monthly ~400. I choose some additional services like 3-year maintainance, lease protection etc., finally it is ~484 monthly). I went to there at 1pm, test drive, run my credit, finance, and took my car home!
The only thing they can make it better is the process time. It takes me ~4 hours to finish to whole process. But since it is a busy day and good quote and good service from Jorainna and the finance guy (Razawi), it is reasonable and acceptable.
So to the conclusion, I am pretty satisfied.This is my first Mercedes car, hope everything going well in the following 3 years. :)< /Review>

<rating>1</rating>< text>
Had a good experience here the last time round...no such luck this time. Everything started out smoothly - we ran my credit for a three year lease, found a car that worked for me in SoCal at which point I shook hands with the manager (PJ) and paid the deposit with the understanding that I had a deal which we would finalize upon pickup. The car arrived at the dealership a few days later, at which point I was told that my credit (which had been run when I made the deposit) was in fact NOT sufficient and the deal was off. To top it off, nearly two months later my DEPOSIT IS STILL MIA, no refund and no explanation despite dozens of calls and unanswered messages.

What should have been a simple pain free (maybe fun?) interaction has dragged into a months long annoyance. MB dealers are usually a pleasure to deal with and my last purchase here was a great one, not sure what to chalk this up to...maybe the new ownership?< /text>

< review>
Bought our second vehicle from the new Stevens Creek Mercedes, (formerly Smythe) now a part of Auto Nation.  Goran was our salesman, and was very knowledgefull of our brand new model ML400.  These new vehicles are high-tech wonders and require assistance to explain their functionality, and Goran breezed through it. We were even introduced to our own service adviser for our upcoming services.  Goran has since called me several times to make sure everything was to my satisfaction and understanding.  If you are going to buy a high-end vehicle in the Bay area, I recommend Stevens Creek Mercedes Benz.  No fuss...no muss.<//review>

<date>1389478835114</date><rate>5< /rate>< Review>
I bought ML350 for my wife about a week ago. Frank (Farbod Homayoun) has been extremely helpful through the process. He was very patient and detailed oriented. After we finished our paper work, it was almost 8 clock. He even helped to drive our car to our home.

I also saw the general manager in this place. He was very kind, professional and called my last name correctly when I left.

Everyone there seems super nice, and right on top of the best service.

<user_id>100717325160831572550< /user_id>< user_name>
Steve Andrade<//user_name>
<time>1426702991012<//time>< rate>

< Review>
I have been a customer of MB Stevens Creek since 2007.  The relationship we've established with this dealership played an important role in our recent decision to stay with a Mercedes product and return to MB of Stevens Creek when we decided to move from a sedan to an SUV.

We drove several suv's, but when we finally decided to try the ML350, I didn't want the test drive to end.

Our main reason for recommending MB Stevens Creek is the service department.  After our first purchase in '07, we were assigned a service adviser.  We were lucky enough to be assigned to Troy Shalk and insisted we stay with him upon our most recent purchase.  It's actually a pleasure to deal with Troy and the entire MBSC staff.  Troy knows our vehicle, he knows us, and we are treated like very valued clients.  It's almost like treating our car to a spa day.  Work is completed thoroughly, the car is returned clean, and we've never had to return for re-work.  Their driveway technician program is great way to have minor issues or questions quickly resolved.

One time after we had been away for a couple of weeks and returned home to find our MB dead electrically, a tow truck was promptly dispatched to our home to pick up the vehicle and take it in for repair.  The problem was quickly diagnosed and resolved, and the entire electrical system was thoroughly tested to make sure no other issues would crop up.

We have other vehicles and deal with other dealerships.  MB Stevens Creek should be teaching seminars on how to treat customers and their vehicles.<//Review>

< Text>
I have been a customer of MB Stevens Creek since 2007.  The relationship we've established with this dealership played an important role in our recent decision to stay with a Mercedes product and return to MB of Stevens Creek when we decided to move from a sedan to an SUV.

We drove several suv's, but when we finally decided to try the ML350, I didn't want the test drive to end.

Our main reason for recommending MB Stevens Creek is the service department.  After our first purchase in '07, we were assigned a service adviser.  We were lucky enough to be assigned to Troy Shalk and insisted we stay with him upon our most recent purchase.  It's actually a pleasure to deal with Troy and the entire MBSC staff.  Troy knows our vehicle, he knows us, and we are treated like very valued clients.  It's almost like treating our car to a spa day.  Work is completed thoroughly, the car is returned clean, and we've never had to return for re-work.  Their driveway technician program is great way to have minor issues or questions quickly resolved.

One time after we had been away for a couple of weeks and returned home to find our MB dead electrically, a tow truck was promptly dispatched to our home to pick up the vehicle and take it in for repair.  The problem was quickly diagnosed and resolved, and the entire electrical system was thoroughly tested to make sure no other issues would crop up.

We have other vehicles and deal with other dealerships.  MB Stevens Creek should be teaching seminars on how to treat customers and their vehicles.<//Text>

< Review>
Bought GLC 300, our very first MB, at this dealership. Like the experience from the beginning to the end from internet quotation to vehicle delivery. The quotation came with a pretty good price. We all know we will negotiate the price at the dealership. But if you give me a completely BS quote - basically MSRP that I already know from the vehicle site - I will not walk into the dealership, thinking there will be too much to negotiate down. Some dealer doesn't even give any number with blah blah reasons.... The quotation from this dealership starts with some amount off the MSRP and this made me think it is seriously wants the business. I walked in with a lot of homework done. Negotiated a price that is reasonable to average buyers and I completed that negotiation in about 30 minutes and left without much frustration or tiresome that usually come from the car shopping experience.

Also like non-pushy sales persons there. No body likes to be pushed to buy an expensive car like MB.< /Review>

<date>1492702889099< /date><Pics>None<//Pics><Text>Thanks to our salesman Eddie Peregrino, this buying experience was the smoothest ever.  In our case, process wasn't a simple one.  We had our hearts set on a new car model that is in very short supply, Mercedes GLC300 4Matic.  Too new to be available used.  Our options were to take whatever was available now, or order a car and wait 3-4 months.  We had a lease-return (a 2014 ML350) to deal with also, so we were under pressure to find a replacement.  Eddie worked with us for 2 months.  Searching for the specific color/option combination we wanted, without luck.  For over a month nothing was available that was even close to what we wanted.  He was getting us ready to place an order, preparing our lease-return, giving us a test drive, etc.  Until 3 weeks ago, he found the perfect car on a ship headed to Los Angeles.  It wasn't even officially available yet, and was headed to another dealership somewhere in the West.  But Eddie managed to find it, have it rerouted to his dealership, monitored its progress, ensured no other salesman got their hands on it.  He called us up 1 week ago, said "your car is here".  Within 1 day, we had the keys in hand.  He worked with us on credit union financing, got us a couple breaks on returning our old car, got a discounted price and, overall, made it a very smooth experience.  Eddie is a great guy, very patient and very knowledgable.  He knows the ins and outs of the leasing process, advised us on the pro's and con's of lease versus purchase.  He is a true professional.  Never once tried to sell us something we didn't want.  Never went into the backroom keeping us waiting.  No bait-and-switch, paid attention to what we wanted.  Treated us well, and got us the exact car we wanted.  Thanks to Eddie, I'd gladly go back to this dealer again.  This is my 10th car and the easiest one I've ever bought.  Thanks Eddie!</Text>< Name>

< Review>
We recently bought a GLK350, which makes it our 3rd Mercedes. We traveled from Central Valley to Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek because of the great service we received in the past and once again they did not disappoint.

We spoke with Shawn Abtahi the day before on the phone and let him know what we were looking for.When we came the next day, he was all prepared and was professional and courteous and took the time to get to know us and what we were looking for in our new purchase. He explained all the features that the SUV had to offer, so we could narrow down the MUST haves for us.  Shawn knows the product he is selling inside and out. Shawn was a pleasure to work with and before we drove our beautiful new Mercedes off the dealership lot, he made sure our car was fully detailed with a full tank of gas, in perfect order before handing over the keys.

The whole sales team were professional and enjoyable to work with. It was a very positive experiences from the time we walked through the door and were greeted by the front desk to shaking Shawn's hand and driving off in our new Mercedes.

The dealership was very clean and inviting with a lovely lounge area. Very professional environment, at the same time friendly and relaxing.

Anyone interested in purchasing a Mercedes, I definitely recommend you give Shawn Abtahi at Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek a call today!

Russ & Linda Catron, Tracy, CA</Review>

<Review>From experience I know that purchasing or leasing an automobile can be frustrating, arduous, stressful and exhausting.   Not so at Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek! < Review>
My family and I were interested in the new 2017 GLS, but in a specific color.  After doing some minimal research, we knew that Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek had the exact model and color we liked.  But to make sure it was actually available, we called them to do an inventory check, and Charlie Shen was more then happy to help us over the phone.  Once he confirmed it was available, we made our way to take a personal look at it.

As we arrived, we were immediately greeted and felt welcomed by the staff.  As we started "window" shopping, we knew that the GLS was the model we wanted to take a closer look at and test drive.  We requested Charlie since he initially helped us out over the phone.  As he started to help us and answer our questions, we realized how knowledgeable and friendly he was.  We felt NO pressure from him at all during the process.  In actuality, we had another competitor SUV in mind prior to us going there.  We told Charlie about it, and he was still more then helpful and even encouraged us to check out the other SUV to make sure we made the right decision for our family.  He even set us up with a test drive with the floor model, since the actual model we wanted was at their warehouse.

After the test drive, we left to check out our other option, but were back at Mercedes with in hours.  After taking a look at our other possible option, we automatically knew that the quality between the GLS and our secondary option were worlds apart.  The GLS had better power, handling, and of course, options!

Once we came back, Charlie was more then happy to speak with us again, even if we weren't necessarily going to purchase the vehicle that day.  Once we test drove the actual model and color we would eventually buy, we knew we were making the right decision.  Charlie and the rest of his team patiently worked with us to crunch the numbers, and a fair deal on both sides.  In the end, I'm happy to say my family and I walked out that night with the family vehicle of our dreams, and we haven't regretted it since.

The whole process from start to finish took more then 8 hours, and Charlie never complained or made us feel like we were wasting his time.  Even when he didn't know we were seriously going to buy the truck!

Again, my family and I want to thank Charlie and the rest of the Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek team for their service, their understanding, and willingness to work with us to make sure we got the car we wanted, at the price we were happy with!</Review>

<rate>5<//rate>< review>
If you want to enjoy purchasing a fine car you need to find a fine dealership. I was lucky because I found Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek when I wanted to buy a Mercedes GLC300.

I first spotted the new GLC while driving to an appointment and, after the appointment looked for the closest dealer. Gurwinder Singh, who was to become my principal sales rep, welcomed me to Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek, presented the car and described many details about it, and then let me take it out for a test drive.

The GLC300, Gurwinder, and the overall classiness of the dealership got my immediate attention, so when I got home I spent quite a bit of time on the MBUSA website detailing out a configuration that would suit my needs. You may imagine that my configuration was not immediately available in the U.S., so Gurwinder worked with his manager Samir Karimi to have me to use a special order slot that was available.

Once the car was ordered there was a long wait (during which my 2016 GLC somehow became a 2017 GLC), but through it all Gurwinder, his partner Bryan Tu, and Samir were patient and helpful.

When the car finally arrived I drove it around a bit and then engaged in the inevitable paperwork shuffle while final detailing of the car was done. Then came a brief training session (which is only a start, but a helpful one). Everything was carried out efficiently by courteous staff members, and I left with no unanswered questions.

Over the years I’ve purchased many cars, including several Mercedes, Jaguars, Infinitis, and other fine cars and, of all the dealers I’ve bought from, Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek stands out as the finest experience I’ve had.<//review>

Excellent service!
They go above and beyond to satisfy the customer.
PJ!! You're the man.

By the time we went to this showroom, we had actually made up our mind to buy an Audi A6. We thought we'll just checkout Mercedes as well.
The first car we sat in was a fully loaded C300 and we were just blown away with the luxury in this car. That completely changed our opinion.
This was the first time we considered Mercedes Benz as an option and we were very nervous about the financial commitment.

About this showroom:
First off, these guys have a huge inventory. There are so many options to choose from.

Sales person Mushtaba was very welcoming and patient to show us many cars. Sales manager Stan explained to us different financial options and Joseph, the sales manager processed our paper work very efficiently.

PJ, an other Sales Manager is just one hell of a guy!!

After the paperwork, Stan was busy with other customers. We were having second thoughts about the deal we got. PJ looked at our situation and asked "Would $X a month make you a happy customer?" which in itself surprised us but he actually went and made that happen after we said yes.

This is the kind of attitude that keeps customers coming back to them. Excellent job PJ and team. Keep up the good work.<//text>

<rating>5</rating><Text>My family and I were interested in the new 2017 GLS, but in a specific color.  After doing some minimal research, we knew that Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek had the exact model and color we liked.  But to make sure it was actually available, we called them to do an inventory check, and Charlie Shen was more then happy to help us over the phone.  Once he confirmed it was available, we made our way to take a personal look at it.

As we arrived, we were immediately greeted and felt welcomed by the staff.  As we started "window" shopping, we knew that the GLS was the model we wanted to take a closer look at and test drive.  We requested Charlie since he initially helped us out over the phone.  As he started to help us and answer our questions, we realized how knowledgeable and friendly he was.  We felt NO pressure from him at all during the process.  In actuality, we had another competitor SUV in mind prior to us going there.  We told Charlie about it, and he was still more then helpful and even encouraged us to check out the other SUV to make sure we made the right decision for our family.  He even set us up with a test drive with the floor model, since the actual model we wanted was at their warehouse.

After the test drive, we left to check out our other option, but were back at Mercedes with in hours.  After taking a look at our other possible option, we automatically knew that the quality between the GLS and our secondary option were worlds apart.  The GLS had better power, handling, and of course, options!

Once we came back, Charlie was more then happy to speak with us again, even if we weren't necessarily going to purchase the vehicle that day.  Once we test drove the actual model and color we would eventually buy, we knew we were making the right decision.  Charlie and the rest of his team patiently worked with us to crunch the numbers, and a fair deal on both sides.  In the end, I'm happy to say my family and I walked out that night with the family vehicle of our dreams, and we haven't regretted it since.

The whole process from start to finish took more then 8 hours, and Charlie never complained or made us feel like we were wasting his time.  Even when he didn't know we were seriously going to buy the truck!

Again, my family and I want to thank Charlie and the rest of the Mercedes-Benz of Stevens Creek team for their service, their understanding, and willingness to work with us to make sure we got the car we wanted, at the price we were happy with!< /Text>< pics>
None</pics>

This is the WORST dealer I have ever been to.
Short Version:
They just do not care about customer service. Once they sell you the vehicle then they don't give a damn. Tin Voung the person who sold me the car, he sent me an email a day later saying - "I am here to help you" - but he never responded to any of my emails of phone calls, TILL DATE!! Long Version:
I was leasing a BMW, once my lease expired I decided to get a Mercedes GLK. I went all the way from WA state to buy a CPO because they had a vehicle that matches all my requirements. After I bought the car the following are the events that happened:
1. They gave me a faulty Media interface cable, when I called the sales person who attended me, he never responded to my calls or emails. I had to talk to his boss only then they sent me a ACTUAL working cable.

2. When I went to DMV in WA state, the officer there explained me that I do not have all the documentation required to get the vehicle registered on my name. It has been 2 and half weeks (at the time of writing) and numerous calls and emails, everytime someone takes down my name and number, no response.

While selling the Extended warranty and other additional stuff, they seem to care about you so much. And once the deal is done, this is what you get. Since I am new to this country I am still figuring out options on what I can do about this, like a consumer court or something.< /text>

<name>Jim Jensen</name><Rating>5</Rating>< Text>
I recently leased a C300 from Mercedes Benz of Stevens Creek. The process was just as I had hoped.  I first contacted the dealership through TrueCar and the account executive, Samir Karimi, gave me prompt quotes for a few different cars.  I asked that he provide his best price because I intended to buy from the dealership that provided the best price.  I disdain the car buying process.  He said he would provide his best price and I confirmed his price was lower than two other dealerships for the same car and much lower than the average discount from MSRP reported through sites like TrueCar.  My other instructions were to have the car and paperwork ready when I came into the dealership.  I was at the dealership for only 20 minutes, which exceeded my expectations.  Samir also went over and beyond his duty after the sale.  We had to take the car into the dealership for a software update to the touchpad and warranty work on the tires.  We intended to receive the instructions on car features during that visit, but the applicable person was not at the dealership at that time.  Samir volunteered to come to our home and showed us how to use at the convenience of our home one night at 8 p.m. Excellent service and I will buy my next Mercedes from him.< /Text>

1405399970532<//Date>
<Review>I have been working with Manuel Chua (sales dept) and it has been the greatest car buying experience I've ever had.

A couple of weeks back (6-8 weeks), I've showed up at Smythe and was looking for the new CLA250. Manuel showed me one of their CLAs but also pointed out that all of them are already pre-sold. He explained me in detail how the order process would work and that it takes 3-4 months until the car would be delivered. Since I didn't want to pre-order a car, Manuel offered to keep an eye on any newly arriving CLAs and let me know as soon as one becomes available.

In the meantime I was also looking at other cars as I already accepted that I won't get a CLA250 in the near future. However, last Friday, I received a call from Manuel, saying: Jan, we have YOUR car here! It just arrived, come tomorrow to test drive it!!! I was positive surprised that Manuel still kept me in mind and seriously kept an eye on the CLAs for me. Of course, I accepted his offer and test drove the CLA250. Since I like to go surfing on my weekends, I wanted to make sure that my car fits all my needs and I even showed up with a surfboard before buying the car. Manuel was happy to show me how we can fit the surfboard INSIDE the car. Since the surfboard fits in the car, I was happy to move on with buying this beauty. After signing all the papers, I've realized that the the Towing Eye Cover was missing on my front pumper. Unfortunately, the service department was already closed and they do not open on Sundays. However, Manuel promised me to get the cover as soon as possible to me. As expected, this afternoon I've received an email stating that the cover is ready for pick-up and installation. When I came to the dealership, Manuel was already waiting for me and also gave me a quick tour through their new office building. Also, he introduced to me to their GM and the service department.

Smythe and especially Manuel Chua have made buying a brand new CLA250 a very easy decision for me.

Summary:
- No buying pressure while browsing around and test driving cars
- Helpful and knowledgeable sales department
- Friendly and professional environment, it almost feels like you know the whole dealership already for years
- Keep their promises
- Constant follow-ups to ensure that you enjoy your new car

I would recommend this dealership without any doubts to all my friends and family members. If you are looking for a Mercedes-Benz, keep an eye out for Manuel Chua at Smythe. I am certain you'll have the same, amazing, customer experience as I did.< /Review>< rating>
5<//rating>

In general when you are buying a Mercedez, your experience of buying a car is always special. That is at least how I felt when I was visiting dealerships.
